subject: Update numbering of dashboard enable files
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-12 16:30:48.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'Update numbering of dashboard enable files

Recently, the Horizon Dashboard project launched a new approach
for loading dashboard panels at startup, and along with that, a
new 4 digit numbering scheme for the files that enable that to
happen.

The change is happening in the designate-dashboard project. This
patch updates the file names that get sym-linked into Horizon.

Change-Id: Ifc9ee0a2afbd6b826993ff03c1d23aacabf3144e
'}]
commit_message:
Update numbering of dashboard enable files

Recently, the Horizon Dashboard project launched a new approach
for loading dashboard panels at startup, and along with that, a
new 4 digit numbering scheme for the files that enable that to
happen.

The change is happening in the designate-dashboard project. This
patch updates the file names that get sym-linked into Horizon.

Change-Id: Ifc9ee0a2afbd6b826993ff03c1d23aacabf3144e

subject: Revert "Add ceilometer action support"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-10 17:03:48.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/actions/openstack/actions.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/actions/openstack/test_ceilometer_generator.py', 'mistral/actions/openstack/mapping.json', 'mistral/tests/unit/actions/openstack/test_openstack_actions.py', 'requirements.txt', 'mistral/actions/openstack/action_generator/generators.py', 'tools/get_action_list.py', 'mistral/actions/generator_factory.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Add ceilometer action support"

This reverts commit b56b6a5d5cc2fea2bf46e8041feb665dd785aec4

This is not an appropriate backport for stable branches
per the policy:

http://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html

Specifically, this is implementing a blueprint in a stable
branch and introducing a new dependency (python-ceilometerclient).

So we should undo this before releasing mistral 1.0.1 for Liberty.

Change-Id: Ifd2e71e752a0adfc4d6c8d4f6d34147cff3d9fa3
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Add ceilometer action support"

This reverts commit b56b6a5d5cc2fea2bf46e8041feb665dd785aec4

This is not an appropriate backport for stable branches
per the policy:

http://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html

Specifically, this is implementing a blueprint in a stable
branch and introducing a new dependency (python-ceilometerclient).

So we should undo this before releasing mistral 1.0.1 for Liberty.

Change-Id: Ifd2e71e752a0adfc4d6c8d4f6d34147cff3d9fa3

Change Freezer repo_url from stackforge to openstack

commit_message:
Backport of some Bug-Fixes from Mitaka

Increase the Freezer devstack steps
Unified devstack plugin about Freezer.Make it easier for
developers to use Freezer
Closes-bug: #1537371
(cherry picked from commit 1da385c5858cc25cc98e5bacceea70b31419d6ca)

Change Freezer repo_url from stackforge to openstack
(cherry picked from commit 2b19697be50811cc7ad2a4003eb5728eb8ebbbac)

Add check for name=='__main__'
 Allow direct execution of freezer.main.
 Useful for development and debugging.
 Update README.rst to reflect latest options.
 (previously, --log-level was not present.)
(cherry picked from commit 87ec7cc17f37fcb3b608a4241bcf649e8de48c02)

Fix a mistake in 'plugin.sh'
Install freezer in devstack,appear the 'configure_freezer'
command is not found $freezer_dir/lib/plugin.sh.
Change 'configure_freezer' to 'configure_freezer_scheduler'.
Closes-Bug: #1536257
(cherry picked from commit 12d790ef48eb88df42d28b53be6e6eed2a08ad3d)

Add Sphinx doc build
Closes-Bug: #1542061
(cherry picked from commit ab794d3d36fcd6e8454b91c716ce213fbe0e14e4)

Start using oslosphinx theme for docs
Closes-Bug: #1542061
(cherry picked from commit 5956339ccaaece3e8ad88b3897bdd1159de48dfc)

Fix freezer for py3 compatibility
(cherry picked from commit c4218f0385e9a4b0f7b3b404b3f3f7ae33966c37)

Swift client does not stringify object names anymore on get_object()
Resolves-Bug: #1537364
(cherry picked from commit b6452ab2f0d82bec7e3ce86365a003f5ed83f270)

Change-Id: I04f1a049cf422651590e96474ac8a349c7a4ba8c

commit_message:
Add VPNaaS API tests in neutron-vpnaas tree

Change [1] implemented that VPN tests are removed from
neutron tree. This change adds the same test with their
resources to run them in neutron-vpnaas tree.

In the other patch, a new CI job can be pushed in project-config
so that this api test can be tested.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/278606

Change-Id: Ia7d7b53aaeda8c328dcb7694f1a9f974e4f2ca31
Closes-Bug: #1483417

commit_message:
Require kombu>=3.0.25

oslo.messaging change d49ddc3b9828f097d5bb39bca0381386a9de7762
assumes a behavior in kombu that was only added in 3.0.25:

https://github.com/celery/kombu/commit/1cfe771f7a586dcad45dfdb2acfdb43403986065

So we should require kombu>=3.0.25 for this to be correct.

Change-Id: Ief102f6627d48b9afa7ad3beea49d9dfb438d0bb
Related-Bug: #1531148

subject: Added Keystone and RequestID headers to CORS middleware
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-02-03 14:11:08.000000000', 'files': ['etc/designate/api-paste.ini'], 'message': "Added Keystone and RequestID headers to CORS middleware

CORS middleware's latent configuration feature, new in 3.0.0,
allows adding headers that apply to all valid origins.
This patch adds headers commonly used in openstack to designate's
paste pipeline, so that operators do not have to be aware of
additional configuration magic to ensure that browsers can talk
to the API.

For more information:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.middleware/cors.html#configuration-for-pastedeploy

Change-Id: I47a4f8db1521cdcbf6fbe714aa9b5dbf6df8b5eb
"}]
commit_message:
Added Keystone and RequestID headers to CORS middleware

CORS middleware's latent configuration feature, new in 3.0.0,
allows adding headers that apply to all valid origins.
This patch adds headers commonly used in openstack to designate's
paste pipeline, so that operators do not have to be aware of
additional configuration magic to ensure that browsers can talk
to the API.

For more information:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.middleware/cors.html#configuration-for-pastedeploy

Change-Id: I47a4f8db1521cdcbf6fbe714aa9b5dbf6df8b5eb

subject: WIP Bump psutil to 3.4.1
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-24 04:19:51.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "WIP Bump psutil to 3.4.1

We're using an antic (from 2013) version of psutil, because newer version
renamed process.get_FOO into process.FOO. Though distributions have
upgraded a long time ago. So we must follow.

This patch attempts to see what's broken. Do not merge yet, until we
can fix things in individual projects.

Change-Id: Ic3bfe2ccd11b05c60c52613230e7b18bc3e6c4a9
"}]
commit_message:
WIP Bump psutil to 3.4.1

We're using an antic (from 2013) version of psutil, because newer version
renamed process.get_FOO into process.FOO. Though distributions have
upgraded a long time ago. So we must follow.

This patch attempts to see what's broken. Do not merge yet, until we
can fix things in individual projects.

Change-Id: Ic3bfe2ccd11b05c60c52613230e7b18bc3e6c4a9

subject: Updated upgrade process for container restarts
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-05 04:10:50.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/upgrade-guide/process.rst', 'scripts/run-upgrade.sh'], 'message': 'Updated upgrade process for container restarts

This change updates the upgrade documentation and script to support
a rolling deployment/update of new and old container types. While
this change is not strictly required and could be accomplished by
simply calling the `setup-hosts.yml` play, however its come to light
that in "some" circumstances a statful group of containers may be
restarted, all at the same time, leading to a service interuption of
a stateful service.

Change-Id: I055cdbb117069fde331762f55db46d03069ba829
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Updated upgrade process for container restarts

This change updates the upgrade documentation and script to support
a rolling deployment/update of new and old container types. While
this change is not strictly required and could be accomplished by
simply calling the `setup-hosts.yml` play, however its come to light
that in "some" circumstances a statful group of containers may be
restarted, all at the same time, leading to a service interuption of
a stateful service.

Change-Id: I055cdbb117069fde331762f55db46d03069ba829
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

Fuel-devops is making a template on-the-fly, taking

(see describe_environment(boot_from=settings.ADMIN_BOOT_DEVICE)).

ISO is uploaded during the environment creation in fuel-devops.

Change-Id: I3a6f850b66873ab704649268c073a24147820568
Closes-Bug:#1544939

commit_message:
Remove redundant uploading ISO

Fuel-devops is making a template on-the-fly, taking
into account the option settings.ADMIN_BOOT_DEVICE
(see describe_environment(boot_from=settings.ADMIN_BOOT_DEVICE)).

ISO is uploaded during the environment creation in fuel-devops.

Change-Id: I3a6f850b66873ab704649268c073a24147820568
Closes-Bug:#1544939

Gentoo provides eclean-dist via the gentoolkit package
eclean-dist isn't needed anyway was /usr/portage is removed anyway

commit_message:
Remove eclean-dist as it's not available by default

Gentoo provides eclean-dist via the gentoolkit package
eclean-dist isn't needed anyway was /usr/portage is removed anyway

Removed redundant package update in cleanup.

Change-Id: Icf4f9ed549b9a6d923448d927d7c42bcf8d6091b

commit_message:
Node roles popover behaviour fix

  - popover is hidden while onMouseMove event in action
  - popover is hidden in case onMouseClick event occurs, till next onMouseEnter
  - it is possible to move cursor inside popover and copy text from it.

Implements: blueprint redesign-of-node-roles-panel

Change-Id: I0bf0f47e0f6699f6e575bf831df25554117958ec

Previous releases could be used if needed be, for example:

commit_message:
Use current CentOS when building ISO

Switch make system to use latest available CentOS version, which is always
accessible at http://mirror.centos.org/centos/$release/.

Previous releases could be used if needed be, for example:
make MIRROR_CENTOS=http://vault.centos.org/7.1.1503/

Change-Id: Id15ddf90fdf5222f94d14865a42680ce8b955eef

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-02-12 00:04:47.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/_drivers/swift/store.py', 'glance_store/tests/unit/test_swift_store.py'], 'message': "Remove unused parameters from swift connection init

glance_store passes some unused parameters such as tenant, auth_version
and others to Multi-tenant store when initializing Swift connection.
The patch removes these parameters from the Connection __init__
method because glance_store doesn't need to pass them - it passes
a valid auth_token to Swift connection (so it doesn't need to
initialize Keystone client and request the token).

Change-Id: I3805f2bb31b7c75d222867aaefefa0f5c0be3847
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unused parameters from swift connection init

glance_store passes some unused parameters such as tenant, auth_version
and others to Multi-tenant store when initializing Swift connection.
The patch removes these parameters from the Connection __init__
method because glance_store doesn't need to pass them - it passes
a valid auth_token to Swift connection (so it doesn't need to
initialize Keystone client and request the token).

Change-Id: I3805f2bb31b7c75d222867aaefefa0f5c0be3847

commit_message:
Better cleanup for Tempest tests

When running our Tempest tests, we are now cleaning up all the
objects we have created within the WatcherDB via a soft_delete.

Partially Implements: blueprint deletion-of-actions-plan

Change-Id: Ibdcfd2be37094377d09ad77d5c20298ee2baa4d0

subject: [Reports] Custom labels for "Scenario Output" charts
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6172, 'name': 'Boris Pavlovic', 'email': 'boris@pavlovic.me', 'username': 'boris-42'}, {'_account_id': 6835, 'name': 'Kun Huang', 'email': 'gareth@openstacker.org', 'username': 'academicgareth'}, {'_account_id': 7369, 'name': 'Sergey Skripnick', 'email': 'sskripnick@mirantis.com', 'username': 'redixin'}, {'_account_id': 8491, 'name': 'Illia Khudoshyn', 'email': 'ikhudoshyn@mirantis.com', 'username': 'ikhudoshyn'}, {'_account_id': 14817, 'name': 'Mirantis Rally CI', 'email': 'rally-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'ci50'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-27 10:56:37.000000000', 'files': ['rally/task/processing/charts.py', 'rally/ui/templates/task/report.html', 'rally/task/processing/plot.py', 'rally/plugins/common/scenarios/dummy/dummy.py', 'tests/unit/plugins/common/scenarios/dummy/test_dummy.py', 'tests/unit/task/test_scenario.py', 'rally/common/objects/task.py', 'tests/unit/task/processing/test_charts.py'], 'message': '[Reports] Custom labels for "Scenario Output" charts

Improvements for charts that related to scenario output:

  * X-axis label can be specified to add_output() by
    "axis_label" key of chart options dict.
    The key is named "axis_label" but not "x_label"
    because chart can be displayed as table, so we explicitly
    mention "axis" in option name to make this parameter
    useless for tables

  * Y-axis label can be specified to add_output() by
    "label" key of chart options dict.
    In some cases this parameter can be used for rendering
    tables - it becomes column name in case if chart with
    single iteration is transformed into table

  * As mentiones above, if we have output chart
    with single iteration, then it is transformed to table,
    because chart with single value is useless

  * OutputLinesChart is added, it is displayed by
    NVD3 lineChart()

  * Chart "description" is optional now. Description is
    not shown if it is not specified explicitly

  * Scenario Dummy.add_output is improved to display labels
    and OutputLinesChart

  * Fix: If Y-values are too long and overlaps chart box,
    then JavaScript updates chart width in runtime to fit
    width of chart graphs + Y values to their DOM container

Change-Id: I7417c0bc54d1a3155e8df06bdd1bd8bfa18b464a
'}]
commit_message:
[Reports] Custom labels for "Scenario Output" charts

Improvements for charts that related to scenario output:

  * X-axis label can be specified to add_output() by
    "axis_label" key of chart options dict.
    The key is named "axis_label" but not "x_label"
    because chart can be displayed as table, so we explicitly
    mention "axis" in option name to make this parameter
    useless for tables

  * Y-axis label can be specified to add_output() by
    "label" key of chart options dict.
    In some cases this parameter can be used for rendering
    tables - it becomes column name in case if chart with
    single iteration is transformed into table

  * As mentiones above, if we have output chart
    with single iteration, then it is transformed to table,
    because chart with single value is useless

  * OutputLinesChart is added, it is displayed by
    NVD3 lineChart()

  * Chart "description" is optional now. Description is
    not shown if it is not specified explicitly

  * Scenario Dummy.add_output is improved to display labels
    and OutputLinesChart

  * Fix: If Y-values are too long and overlaps chart box,
    then JavaScript updates chart width in runtime to fit
    width of chart graphs + Y values to their DOM container

Change-Id: I7417c0bc54d1a3155e8df06bdd1bd8bfa18b464a

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-08 09:50:15.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/objects/test_base.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/objects/test_consistencygroup.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/objects/test_backup.py', 'tests-py3.txt', 'cinder/tests/unit/objects/test_volume_type.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/objects/test_service.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/objects/test_cgsnapshot.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_backups.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/objects/__init__.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/objects/test_volume.py', 'cinder/objects/backup.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/objects/test_snapshot.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/objects/test_volume_attachment.py'], 'message': 'Port objects unit tests to Python 3

* BaseObjectsTestCase._compare(): replace hasattr() with getattr()
  and a white list of expected exceptions. On Python 2, hasattr()
  ignores *all* exceptions and so may hide real bugs.
* Mocks: except a call to obj.__bool__() rather than
  obj.__nonzero__() on Python 3. bool(obj) now calls obj.__bool__()
  on Python 3.
* Replace dict.keys() with list(dict.keys()) to get a list on Python
  3. On Python 3, dict.keys() now returns a view.
* JSON/base64:

  * Replace jsonutils.dumps() with jsonutils.dump_as_bytes() to get
    JSON as bytes
  * Replace base64.encodestring() with oslo_serialization.base64.encode_as_text() to get
    base64 as bytes
  * Replace base64.decodestring() with
    oslo_serialization.base64.decode_as_text() to accept Unicode and
    return Unicode

* tests-py3.txt: add cinder.tests.unit.objects.test_* (11 files)

Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: I9ce7753eb947bf9a5c91e643f5c65156c8e3f7cc
'}]
commit_message:
Port objects unit tests to Python 3

* BaseObjectsTestCase._compare(): replace hasattr() with getattr()
  and a white list of expected exceptions. On Python 2, hasattr()
  ignores *all* exceptions and so may hide real bugs.
* Mocks: except a call to obj.__bool__() rather than
  obj.__nonzero__() on Python 3. bool(obj) now calls obj.__bool__()
  on Python 3.
* Replace dict.keys() with list(dict.keys()) to get a list on Python
  3. On Python 3, dict.keys() now returns a view.
* JSON/base64:

  * Replace jsonutils.dumps() with jsonutils.dump_as_bytes() to get
    JSON as bytes
  * Replace base64.encodestring() with oslo_serialization.base64.encode_as_text() to get
    base64 as bytes
  * Replace base64.decodestring() with
    oslo_serialization.base64.decode_as_text() to accept Unicode and
    return Unicode

* tests-py3.txt: add cinder.tests.unit.objects.test_* (11 files)

Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: I9ce7753eb947bf9a5c91e643f5c65156c8e3f7cc

subject: Reflect provider change in puppet-openstacklib
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-12 01:11:08.000000000', 'files': ['metadata.json', 'lib/puppet/type/zaqar_config.rb', 'spec/unit/provider/zaqar_config/ini_setting_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/zaqar_config/ini_setting.rb', 'README.md'], 'message': "Reflect provider change in puppet-openstacklib

With the creation of the new openstack_config provider, some
essing
that was done in zaqar_config has been centralized in
openstack_config.

Impacted methods are :

  * section
  * setting
  * separator

Also, this commit adds the fact that, when passing a specific string
(ensure_absent_val) the provider will behave as if ensure => absent
was
specified. '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' is the default value for
ensure_absent_val.

The use case is the following :

zaqar_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => 'bar' } # will work as
l

zaqar_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' } #
 mean absent

That means that all the current :

if $myvar {
  zaqar_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }
} else {
  zaqar_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : ensure => absent }
}

can be removed in favor of :

zaqar_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }

If for any reason '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' turns out to be a valid value
for a specific parameter. One could by pass that doing the following

zaqar_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>',
 ensure_absent_val => 'foo' }

Change-Id: Iaaf2e5755080ef32d7d585465aaea6fd408d0ece
"}]
commit_message:
Reflect provider change in puppet-openstacklib

With the creation of the new openstack_config provider, some
essing
that was done in zaqar_config has been centralized in
openstack_config.

Impacted methods are :

  * section
  * setting
  * separator

Also, this commit adds the fact that, when passing a specific string
(ensure_absent_val) the provider will behave as if ensure => absent
was
specified. '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' is the default value for
ensure_absent_val.

The use case is the following :

zaqar_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => 'bar' } # will work as
l

zaqar_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' } #
 mean absent

That means that all the current :

if $myvar {
  zaqar_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }
} else {
  zaqar_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : ensure => absent }
}

can be removed in favor of :

zaqar_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }

If for any reason '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' turns out to be a valid value
for a specific parameter. One could by pass that doing the following

zaqar_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>',
 ensure_absent_val => 'foo' }

Change-Id: Iaaf2e5755080ef32d7d585465aaea6fd408d0ece

commit_message:
repos: bump RDO to a latest repo

Since RDO did not promote current-passed-ci for a while let's bump the
repo to the latest URL available, so we can have some new packages and
test latest Mitaka.

Also it will help to have acceptance tests working on Mistral, since a
bug has been fixed in packaging but not promoted.

Change-Id: I4f8b213354d18a11c0d97250f1b88c7927790c7f

commit_message:
Fix race condition for nova and heat tasks

This fix splits execution of tasks on controller
nodes to avoid race conditions as puppet providers
cannot handle conflicts properly during parallel
application.

Change-Id: I54099eb37051af12b1108ebca398d42b5c63d1f6
Closes-bug: #1544927

commit_message:
Port parse_mime_headers() to Python 3

Port swift.common.utils.parse_mime_headers() to Python 3:

* On Python 3, tries to decode headers from UTF-8. If an header was
  was not encoded to UTF-8, decode the header from Latin1.
* Update the parse_mime_headers() tests: on Python 3, HTTP header
  values are Unicode strings.

This change is a follow-up of the change
Ia5ee2ead67e36e8c6416183667f64ae255887736.

Change-Id: I042dd13e9eb0e9844ccd832d538cdac84359ed42

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-10 20:19:36.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/api/test_fwaas_extensions.py'], 'message': 'Remove fwaas tests from the Neutron API tree

It is important to remove these tests for a number of
reasons:

a) the fwaas team is working on a new version of the
   API; testing the old API is clearly not gonna be
   useful.
b) changes to the neutron_fwaas repo can unexpectedly
   break Neutron, forcing us to co-gate on a fwaas
   fix to solve the empasse.

The FWaaS team should pursue a decoupled testing
strategy, where these types of tests are used to gate
on the fwaas repo itself. As a temporary measure a
co-gate to neutron would be acceptable (like lbaas)
until neutron-lib takes proper life.

Change-Id: Ia7eacccad9407ffb37bf4eec16af12eae713c5b2
'}]
commit_message:
Remove fwaas tests from the Neutron API tree

It is important to remove these tests for a number of
reasons:

a) the fwaas team is working on a new version of the
   API; testing the old API is clearly not gonna be
   useful.
b) changes to the neutron_fwaas repo can unexpectedly
   break Neutron, forcing us to co-gate on a fwaas
   fix to solve the empasse.

The FWaaS team should pursue a decoupled testing
strategy, where these types of tests are used to gate
on the fwaas repo itself. As a temporary measure a
co-gate to neutron would be acceptable (like lbaas)
until neutron-lib takes proper life.

Change-Id: Ia7eacccad9407ffb37bf4eec16af12eae713c5b2

subject: Remove dependency on python2_lxc git source
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-12 14:31:25.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/lxc_install.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Remove dependency on python2_lxc git source

The git source for python2_lxc was necessary before the package was
available on pypi, which it now is:
 - https://pypi.python.org/pypi/lxc-python2

This patch adds the pypi package to the lxc_hosts role, and the task
to install it. A subsequent patch will remove the git source from
OpenStack-Ansible.

Change-Id: I5ad9a5eba5460b77f848b8a2265a0842b11af40c
'}]
commit_message:
Remove dependency on python2_lxc git source

The git source for python2_lxc was necessary before the package was
available on pypi, which it now is:
 - https://pypi.python.org/pypi/lxc-python2

This patch adds the pypi package to the lxc_hosts role, and the task
to install it. A subsequent patch will remove the git source from
OpenStack-Ansible.

Change-Id: I5ad9a5eba5460b77f848b8a2265a0842b11af40c

commit_message:
Resolve ansible-lint ANSIBLE0008

ansible-lint 2.3.7 added a rule checking for use of the deprecated
'sudo' and 'sudo_user' directives. They have been replaced with 'become'
and 'become_user' respectively.

Change-Id: I2271fe8468840884f19f41abba37e696c6296350

subject: Allow assigning profiles based on XXX_profile capabilities
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-25 12:21:25.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/tests/test_utils.py', 'tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_profiles.py', 'tripleoclient/tests/v1/test_overcloud_profiles.py', 'tripleoclient/utils.py', 'tripleoclient/exceptions.py', 'tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_deploy/test_overcloud_deploy_validators.py', 'setup.cfg', 'tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py'], 'message': "Allow assigning profiles based on XXX_profile capabilities

This change will allow users (or ironic-inspector) to provide
several possible profiles for a node by setting capabilities like
XXX_profile (where XXX = compute, controller...).

Two new commands are added:

 openstack overcloud profiles match

    When no enough nodes with a given profile are found, this command
    will inspect nodes with such capabilities and choose missing nodes
    from them.

 openstack overcloud profiles list

    Lists all available and active nodes with their profiles and possible
    profiles.

See the following thread for the full background:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-November/078884.html

This changes refactores profile validation code in the deploy command to use
the same logic as commands above. It's worth noting that this change also
removes an incorrect assumption that a node can have multiple values
for the same capability. It also makes sure we only take active and available
nodes into account for all calculations.

Conflicts:
	tripleoclient/exceptions.py
	tripleoclient/tests/test_utils.py
	tripleoclient/utils.py
	tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py

Change-Id: I398cf2052b280eaf67e5755412c35fe9551c341f
(cherry picked from commit 2e680eafa98b1e8face0a1af4db3b3013eb88f6c)
"}]
commit_message:
Allow assigning profiles based on XXX_profile capabilities

This change will allow users (or ironic-inspector) to provide
several possible profiles for a node by setting capabilities like
XXX_profile (where XXX = compute, controller...).

Two new commands are added:

 openstack overcloud profiles match

    When no enough nodes with a given profile are found, this command
    will inspect nodes with such capabilities and choose missing nodes
    from them.

 openstack overcloud profiles list

    Lists all available and active nodes with their profiles and possible
    profiles.

See the following thread for the full background:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-November/078884.html

This changes refactores profile validation code in the deploy command to use
the same logic as commands above. It's worth noting that this change also
removes an incorrect assumption that a node can have multiple values
for the same capability. It also makes sure we only take active and available
nodes into account for all calculations.

Conflicts:
	tripleoclient/exceptions.py
	tripleoclient/tests/test_utils.py
	tripleoclient/utils.py
	tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py

Change-Id: I398cf2052b280eaf67e5755412c35fe9551c341f
(cherry picked from commit 2e680eafa98b1e8face0a1af4db3b3013eb88f6c)

subject: Update tox config and add bashate E006, E040 exceptions
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-12 11:59:03.000000000', 'files': ['tests/ansible.cfg', 'test-requirements.txt', 'tests/test.yml', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Update tox config and add bashate E006, E040 exceptions

This patch updates the tox.ini the same bashate exceptions as are
currently in the OpenStack-Ansible playbook repo.

It also ensures that the linters and all lint targets work
appropriately and normalises the tox.ini configuration to use
uniform formatting.

The use of ansible.cfg is removed as there is no way of being
certain which paths can be used without reverting to an ugly
sed hack in the commands. This is why it is preferred to make
use of environment variables which make use of tox's default
substitutions instead. It's a more reliable way of achieving
the goal for the purpose of gating and testing.

The switch to using a git clone instead of ansible-galaxy to
download the plugins is due to the path spec not being able to
work in Ansible 2.x. [1]

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/13563

Change-Id: I078ad3c5751b7da09ec8553c90f261fc4d2f534f
"}]
commit_message:
Update tox config and add bashate E006, E040 exceptions

This patch updates the tox.ini the same bashate exceptions as are
currently in the OpenStack-Ansible playbook repo.

It also ensures that the linters and all lint targets work
appropriately and normalises the tox.ini configuration to use
uniform formatting.

The use of ansible.cfg is removed as there is no way of being
certain which paths can be used without reverting to an ugly
sed hack in the commands. This is why it is preferred to make
use of environment variables which make use of tox's default
substitutions instead. It's a more reliable way of achieving
the goal for the purpose of gating and testing.

The switch to using a git clone instead of ansible-galaxy to
download the plugins is due to the path spec not being able to
work in Ansible 2.x. [1]

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/13563

Change-Id: I078ad3c5751b7da09ec8553c90f261fc4d2f534f

commit_message:
Update tox config and add bashate E006, E040 exceptions

This patch updates the tox.ini the same bashate exceptions as are
currently in the OpenStack-Ansible playbook repo.

It also ensures that the linters and all lint targets work
appropriately and normalises the tox.ini configuration to use
uniform formatting.

The use of ansible.cfg is removed as there is no way of being
certain which paths can be used without reverting to an ugly
sed hack in the commands. This is why it is preferred to make
use of environment variables which make use of tox's default
substitutions instead. It's a more reliable way of achieving
the goal for the purpose of gating and testing.

The switch to using a git clone instead of ansible-galaxy to

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-15 06:15:06.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/volumes/volume_types/forms.py'], 'message': 'Remove current consumer in QoS spec edit

In QoS spec edit consumer, the choices including the current choices.
If we select the current choice again, we are getting form error.
Instead of this, this patch removing the current choice from the list.
Displays the current consumer in read only field.

Change-Id: Ie30517a34146f9bf1e8859088cb030f4032e6649

commit_message:
Remove current consumer in QoS spec edit

In QoS spec edit consumer, the choices including the current choices.
If we select the current choice again, we are getting form error.
Instead of this, this patch removing the current choice from the list.
Displays the current consumer in read only field.

Change-Id: Ie30517a34146f9bf1e8859088cb030f4032e6649
Closes-Bug: #1466773

subject: Protect 'show' and 'index' with Retry decorator
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6854, 'name': 'YAMAMOTO Takashi', 'email': 'yamamoto@midokura.com', 'username': 'yamamoto'}, {'_account_id': 8124, 'name': 'cbrandily', 'email': 'zzelle@gmail.com', 'username': 'cbrandily'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 9681, 'name': 'Ryu CI', 'email': 'ryu-openstack-review@lists.sourceforge.net', 'username': 'neutronryu', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-05 11:41:37.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/api/v2/test_base.py', 'neutron/api/v2/base.py'], 'message': "Protect 'show' and 'index' with Retry decorator

Commit 77de9653fd60a802b11f157972f7b3e81497e8a7 added a RetryRequest
exception to the policy engine for when items disappeared during policy
enforcement lookups. However, the API was not catching them for the
show and list operations.

This patch adds the decorators to the two methods to catch any
retry exception that may be emitted from the policy engine or
wherever else.

Closes-Bug: #1528031
Change-Id: If4aea5245cdbb2ea545e9a96d73386e3c21a3696
(cherry-picked from 2a27361cf50259281924dbdaba3f06367ef327e7)
"}]
commit_message:
Protect 'show' and 'index' with Retry decorator

Commit 77de9653fd60a802b11f157972f7b3e81497e8a7 added a RetryRequest
exception to the policy engine for when items disappeared during policy
enforcement lookups. However, the API was not catching them for the
show and list operations.

This patch adds the decorators to the two methods to catch any
retry exception that may be emitted from the policy engine or
wherever else.

Closes-Bug: #1528031
Change-Id: If4aea5245cdbb2ea545e9a96d73386e3c21a3696
(cherry-picked from 2a27361cf50259281924dbdaba3f06367ef327e7)

commit_message:
Add generated port id to port dict

Port id generated in create_port was not populated back to port_dict.
As a result port id information was not available on
AddressRequestFactory level (used by 3rd party ipam providers).

This fix populates port_id into copied port dict (to prevent affecting
incoming port dict).
Added UT to make sure that port id is added to port dict which is passed
to AddressFactory.

Change-Id: I62e4d9e887488b9ceeafb90b044f95a22c1765b0
Closes-Bug: #1527089
(cherry picked from commit b2d656aff46ac5a2aa9700fc9ff682ef82ecf8e9)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-08 16:07:32.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_dhcp.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py'], 'message': "Fix bug when enable configuration named dnsmasq_base_log_dir

DHCP agent will report an error when enable configuration
named 'dnsmasq_base_log_dir'.

For example, if this configuration is set to '/tmp'.
The code checks dir '/tmp' if exists. This is wrong.
The right way is to check '/tmp + [network_id]' existence.

Change-Id: I0e060ca7c84f38bb0ccd55ac16da5446a3d015c5
Closes-Bug: #1538386
(cherry picked from commit 8ae32a6681ad9187e1394b9c633a6eb43df40342)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix bug when enable configuration named dnsmasq_base_log_dir

DHCP agent will report an error when enable configuration
named 'dnsmasq_base_log_dir'.

For example, if this configuration is set to '/tmp'.
The code checks dir '/tmp' if exists. This is wrong.
The right way is to check '/tmp + [network_id]' existence.

Change-Id: I0e060ca7c84f38bb0ccd55ac16da5446a3d015c5
Closes-Bug: #1538386
(cherry picked from commit 8ae32a6681ad9187e1394b9c633a6eb43df40342)

commit_message:
Fix identity api v2.0 authentication example

The sample authentication request for identity api v2.0 uses the keys
"tenantId" and "userId", but the corresponding values are names.
This patch replaces "tenantId" with "tenantName" and "userId" with
"username".

Change-Id: Ie5adfb5a0eaa58517f925d2f3ca0f3fb3cc17d37

commit_message:
OpenVPN deployment with Murano, for OpenStack

OpenVPN allows for a secure & encrypted channel of communication between
end points on different networks. It does so by createing secure
ethernet bridges using virtual tap devices. This feature enables nodes
on private network to onboard nodes on public network to present a
seemless and virtually unified cluster in a hybrid environment.

Implements: blueprint murano-openvpn

Change-Id: Id1ae441d500828b47599e73f00b648c48f9af2ec
Co-Authored-By: Bhasker Nallapothula <bhaskern@vedams.com>
Co-Authored-By: Gangadhar Sunkara <gangadhars@vedams.com>
Co-Authored-By: Pradip Kumar Rawat <pradipkumarr@vedams.com>
Co-Authored-By: Shanker Iyer <shankeri@vedams.com>

commit_message:
Resolve ansible-lint ANSIBLE0008

ansible-lint 2.3.7 added a rule checking for use of the deprecated
'sudo' and 'sudo_user' directives. They have been replaced with 'become'
and 'become_user' respectively.

This is a backport of https://review.openstack.org/279038 without the
unnecessary (for Liberty) changes to test-requirements.txt and tox.ini

Change-Id: I2271fe8468840884f19f41abba37e696c6296350

commit_message:
Sync Manila Tempest plugin with latest Tempest

Two reasons to do it:
1) Broken compatibility of old Tempest we use with latest dependencies.
2) Manila Tempest plugin is incompatible with latest Tempest.

Change-Id: Iae5a656b72e774d9d62b52d7ffb63edecbb23ca6
Closes-Bug: #1513105
(cherry picked from commit 0af26bbba27b8bd15422032e6c1447fb7df1daf0)

commit_message:
Add methods for RequestContext to switch db connection

This augments the RequestContext with connection information for a
target database to query.  This will allow nova-api to issue queries to
a targeted cell database with each query.

Example usages:

    ctxt = context.RequestContext()
    cell_mapping = CellMapping()

    with context.target_cell(ctxt, cell_mapping):
        instance = objects.Instance.get_by_uuid(ctxt, uuid)

    with context.target_cell(ctxt, cell_mapping):
        with instance.obj_alternate_context(ctxt):
            instance.save()

Implements blueprint cells-db-connection-switching

Co-Authored-By: melanie witt<melwitt@yahoo-inc.com>

Change-Id: I9e2363a35b58ae55bd40194c1f8bfb89b599bf04

commit_message:
Remove redundant database sync action

As of versions 7.0 and 8.0, database sync for nailgun and keystone
DBs are performed at startup of respective docker containers.

Remove the call that performs redundant sync for those databases.

Blueprint: create-standalone-script-to-backup-masternode
(cherry picked from commit ed2cc645bcb11eb2562f9c3ccbffa5082a962def)

immediately after the /etc/fuel/astute.yaml file is updates
with values from backup.

Introducing a new library to retrieve information from libosinfo database.

Libosinfo database provides information about an optimal hardware configuration
for the guest instances, based on their Operating Systems.
Using this library it will be easier for the end user to boot a guest instance
with an optimal configuration by just providing the guest's OS name.

The following are the acceptable attributes:

 * 'short-id' - the short name of the OS
    eg fedora21, winxp

 * 'id' - the unique URI identifier of the OS
    eg http://fedoraproject.org/fedora/21, http://microsoft.com/win/xp

DocImpact
Partially Implements blueprint libvirt-hardware-policy-from-libosinfo

Change-Id: I35564d6280883e912030236fc23f233d19f56d38
"}]
commit_message:
virt: introduce libosinfo library to set hardware policy

Introducing a new library to retrieve information from libosinfo database.

Libosinfo database provides information about an optimal hardware configuration
for the guest instances, based on their Operating Systems.
Using this library it will be easier for the end user to boot a guest instance
with an optimal configuration by just providing the guest's OS name.

The following are the acceptable attributes:

 * 'short-id' - the short name of the OS
    eg fedora21, winxp

 * 'id' - the unique URI identifier of the OS
    eg http://fedoraproject.org/fedora/21, http://microsoft.com/win/xp

DocImpact
Partially Implements blueprint libvirt-hardware-policy-from-libosinfo

Change-Id: I35564d6280883e912030236fc23f233d19f56d38

On "create security group" API, parameters should be string (not None).

commit_message:
Add jsonschema validation for creating secgroup

On "create security group" API, parameters should be string (not None).
However, it is difficult to handle them because of python get() which
returns None if a key doesn't exist.
For denying None parameters on the API, this patch adds jsonschema
validation to the API.

Change-Id: Id531b48a7f206e0f835c2c7e403a7b2668529ae3
Related-Bug: #1460875

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-02-12 10:47:55.000000000', 'files': ['tests/ansible.cfg', 'tests/ansible-role-requirements.yml', 'test-requirements.txt', 'tests/test.yml', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Update tox config and add bashate E006, E040 exceptions

This patch updates the tox.ini the same bashate exceptions as are
currently in the OpenStack-Ansible playbook repo.

It also ensures that the linters and all lint targets work
appropriately and normalises the tox.ini configuration to use
uniform formatting.

The use of ansible.cfg is removed as there is no way of being
certain which paths can be used without reverting to an ugly
sed hack in the commands. This is why it is preferred to make
use of environment variables which make use of tox's default
substitutions instead. It's a more reliable way of achieving
the goal for the purpose of gating and testing.

The switch to using a git clone instead of ansible-galaxy to
download the plugins is due to the path spec not being able to
work in Ansible 2.x. [1]

Change-Id: I077c5b79a95e78fd81c33382843273893d48bbb6
"}]
commit_message:
Update tox config and add bashate E006, E040 exceptions

This patch updates the tox.ini the same bashate exceptions as are
currently in the OpenStack-Ansible playbook repo.

It also ensures that the linters and all lint targets work
appropriately and normalises the tox.ini configuration to use
uniform formatting.

The use of ansible.cfg is removed as there is no way of being
certain which paths can be used without reverting to an ugly
sed hack in the commands. This is why it is preferred to make
use of environment variables which make use of tox's default
substitutions instead. It's a more reliable way of achieving
the goal for the purpose of gating and testing.

The switch to using a git clone instead of ansible-galaxy to
download the plugins is due to the path spec not being able to
work in Ansible 2.x. [1]

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/13563

Change-Id: I077c5b79a95e78fd81c33382843273893d48bbb6

[inspector] allow changing list of processing hooks

Processing hooks are ironic-inspector plugins for the data processing
pipeline. This change enables appending new hooks to the default list.

commit_message:
Do not set Swift parameters defaults in keyword arguments

The configuration values are not initialized at the moment of import,
so it has no effect. The only reason we didn't hit it is due to helper
functions overriding the arguments. But extra_hardware plugin does not work.

Change-Id: If23bbdc4162589707cd63e6446a92036436b7f2a
Closes-Bug: #1544613
(cherry picked from commit f56bf0c8c214c499b17f84f75bb3870ab1c18873)

subject: Don't use time.timezone
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-02-11 15:58:23.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/utils.py', 'gnocchi/tests/test_storage.py', 'gnocchi/carbonara.py', 'gnocchi/tests/test_utils.py'], 'message': "Don't use time.timezone

We can't use time.mktime() - time.timezone because they are not always is
sync when the OS timezone change. time.mktime() returns the new TZ instantly,
while time.timezone returns the old one.

time.* constants are updated only when time.tzset() is called.

This change computes unix timestamp without using time.timezone constant.

Closes-bug: #1544014

Change-Id: I825814e270a41870e9f4b1c559f66771f049f884
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use time.timezone

We can't use time.mktime() - time.timezone because they are not always is
sync when the OS timezone change. time.mktime() returns the new TZ instantly,
while time.timezone returns the old one.

time.* constants are updated only when time.tzset() is called.

This change computes unix timestamp without using time.timezone constant.

Closes-bug: #1544014

Change-Id: I825814e270a41870e9f4b1c559f66771f049f884

subject: Extend ping test create timeout
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-11 21:15:34.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/tripleo.sh'], 'message': "Extend ping test create timeout

Now that we're using a Fedora image, it appears to take longer to
spawn the VM on some jobs.  One that failed took 167 seconds just
to start the instance, which is uncomfortably close to our timeout
of 180 seconds.  Other than the long spawn time everything appeared
to have worked correctly, so it probably would have passed otherwise.

Bumping the timeout to 360 to match the ping timeout.  In
successful runs it generally won't take that long anyway so it
shouldn't add any significant time to CI runs.

Change-Id: Icd587c8858bbf817c4405932e246a4b890ded11f
(cherry picked from commit 37864a168e06283ea58cbde16ebd81fb00195dcb)
"}]
commit_message:
Extend ping test create timeout

Now that we're using a Fedora image, it appears to take longer to
spawn the VM on some jobs.  One that failed took 167 seconds just
to start the instance, which is uncomfortably close to our timeout
of 180 seconds.  Other than the long spawn time everything appeared
to have worked correctly, so it probably would have passed otherwise.

Bumping the timeout to 360 to match the ping timeout.  In
successful runs it generally won't take that long anyway so it
shouldn't add any significant time to CI runs.

Change-Id: Icd587c8858bbf817c4405932e246a4b890ded11f
(cherry picked from commit 37864a168e06283ea58cbde16ebd81fb00195dcb)

Bumping the timeout to 360 to match the ping timeout.  In

commit_message:
Extend ping test create timeout

Now that we're using a Fedora image, it appears to take longer to
spawn the VM on some jobs.  One that failed took 167 seconds just
to start the instance, which is uncomfortably close to our timeout
of 180 seconds.  Other than the long spawn time everything appeared
to have worked correctly, so it probably would have passed otherwise.

Bumping the timeout to 360 to match the ping timeout.  In
successful runs it generally won't take that long anyway so it
shouldn't add any significant time to CI runs.

Change-Id: Icd587c8858bbf817c4405932e246a4b890ded11f

subject: Fix hard drive size miscalculation
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3009, 'name': 'Vladimir Kozhukalov', 'email': 'kozhukalov@gmail.com', 'username': 'kozhukalov'}, {'_account_id': 6571, 'name': 'Krzysztof Szukiełojć', 'email': 'kszukielojc@mirantis.com', 'username': 'krzysztof+launchpad'}, {'_account_id': 8003, 'name': 'Aleksandr Gordeev', 'email': 'agordeev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'agordeev'}, {'_account_id': 8749, 'name': 'Evgeniy L', 'email': 'eli@mirantis.com', 'username': 'evgeniyl'}, {'_account_id': 8776, 'name': 'Vladimir Sharshov', 'email': 'vsharshov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'warpc'}, {'_account_id': 8935, 'name': 'Andrey Danin', 'email': 'gcon.monolake@gmail.com', 'username': 'adanin'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13194, 'name': 'Alexei Sheplyakov', 'email': 'asheplyakov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'asheplyakov'}, {'_account_id': 14357, 'name': 'fuel-osci-bot', 'email': 'fuel-osci-bot@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-osci-bot'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-02-12 09:55:33.000000000', 'files': ['agent'], 'message': 'Fix hard drive size miscalculation

On Linux ohai gets the block device size from /sys/block/$device/size.
That size is always measured in units of 512 bytes even if the "physical"
block size of the device in question is different [1][2]. On the other hand
/sys/block/$device/queue/logical_block_size is the smallest unit which
the device can address, and /sys/block/$device/queue/physical_block_size
is the smallest unit the physical storage device can write atomically.
Typically SATA/SAS drives having the size >= 2 TB have 4 KB physical
sectors and expose 512 "logical" block size to the operating system.
However some hard drives (for instance, HGST Ultrastar 7K6000 SAS drive)
expose the actual physical sector size (that is, 4 KB) for the efficiency
reasons. As a result nailgun-agent miscomputes the size of the hard drive
(it's 8x off!)

[1] http://lxr.free-electrons.com/source/include/linux/types.h?v=4.4#L124
[2] http://lxr.free-electrons.com/source/drivers/scsi/sd.c?v=4.4#L2340

Change-Id: Iae36b11dce8e6f43d7ee4bddac5098c633883ed6
Closes-Bug: #1544816
'}]
commit_message:
Fix hard drive size miscalculation

On Linux ohai gets the block device size from /sys/block/$device/size.
That size is always measured in units of 512 bytes even if the "physical"
block size of the device in question is different [1][2]. On the other hand
/sys/block/$device/queue/logical_block_size is the smallest unit which
the device can address, and /sys/block/$device/queue/physical_block_size
is the smallest unit the physical storage device can write atomically.
Typically SATA/SAS drives having the size >= 2 TB have 4 KB physical
sectors and expose 512 "logical" block size to the operating system.
However some hard drives (for instance, HGST Ultrastar 7K6000 SAS drive)
expose the actual physical sector size (that is, 4 KB) for the efficiency
reasons. As a result nailgun-agent miscomputes the size of the hard drive
(it's 8x off!)

[1] http://lxr.free-electrons.com/source/include/linux/types.h?v=4.4#L124
[2] http://lxr.free-electrons.com/source/drivers/scsi/sd.c?v=4.4#L2340

Change-Id: Iae36b11dce8e6f43d7ee4bddac5098c633883ed6
Closes-Bug: #1544816

commit_message:
Implement Workers parameters

* For each OpenStack service, create a new parameter to change worker
  number (default to 0 to keep default behavior)
* Use the parameter in Puppet configuration (Hiera) to configure the
  services with the number of workers defined by the parameter.

(cherry picked from commit 789ac548e23d4f5778512e9c756f12171cf82791)

commit_message:
Run 'puppet apply' command at host

Run command 'puppet apply' in host system at Fuel Admin node
immediately after the /etc/fuel/astute.yaml file is updates
with values from backup.

Change-Id: Ibd59fb6b0d2d37f708e8d4c48c99a92d4e9ceef9
Blueprint: create-standalone-script-to-backup-masternode

subject: Remove CONF.compute.run_ssh usage from scenarios
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-27 06:50:59.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/test_server_basic_ops.py'], 'message': 'Remove CONF.compute.run_ssh usage from scenarios

test_server_basic_ops was the only scenario which
used this option all other scenario uses ssh regardless to this
option. When this test used as `input-scenario` using the
CONF.input_scenario.non_ssh_image_regex option also
can be used to disable the ssh.

Change-Id: Ic202c2eb186d2752e3bc1aa636384693360bb47c
'}]
commit_message:
Remove CONF.compute.run_ssh usage from scenarios

test_server_basic_ops was the only scenario which
used this option all other scenario uses ssh regardless to this
option. When this test used as `input-scenario` using the
CONF.input_scenario.non_ssh_image_regex option also
can be used to disable the ssh.

Change-Id: Ic202c2eb186d2752e3bc1aa636384693360bb47c

- Remove CENTOS_7 conditions from setup_environment method
- Change force_fuel_stats_sending logic because statsenderd.log
was re-created after systemctl restart in 2-3 seconds
- Add 2 waits to check_oswl_stat method because after systemctl restart
resource was added to db in 2-3 seconds
- Add wait and retry for sending statistic because sometimes
after restarting statsenderd stat wasn't sent

Closes-Bug: #1543081
Change-Id: Ib6f0d980ab26a4282fa9cb64315413de73d2db1b

commit_message:
Enable statistic sending in system tests

- Remove CENTOS_7 conditions from setup_environment method
- Change force_fuel_stats_sending logic because statsenderd.log
was re-created after systemctl restart in 2-3 seconds
- Add 2 waits to check_oswl_stat method because after systemctl restart
resource was added to db in 2-3 seconds
- Add wait and retry for sending statistic because sometimes
after restarting statsenderd stat wasn't sent

Closes-Bug: #1543081
Change-Id: Ib6f0d980ab26a4282fa9cb64315413de73d2db1b

commit_message:
Don't write PXE config during ACTIVE takeover

If the node has reached an active state and the root_uuid is known then
we should use that rather than rewriting the PXE config.

Change-Id: Id8a1b46c82e31dadfb1a9dee9ae19bba536b6e4f

Intermittently deleting a load balancer would lead to an
PortNotFoundClient exception that would make DeallocateVip
revert.  This patch fixes an except statement that was catching

Change-Id: Ia752ee7a1be339533e478d1646ad215e1c7507d4
Closes-Bug: #1544375
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes an intermittent load balancer delete failure

Intermittently deleting a load balancer would lead to an
PortNotFoundClient exception that would make DeallocateVip
revert.  This patch fixes an except statement that was catching
the wrong exception.

Change-Id: Ia752ee7a1be339533e478d1646ad215e1c7507d4
Closes-Bug: #1544375

commit_message:
Add cap for ansible-lint

ansible-lint 2.3.7 added a rule checking for use of the deprecated
'sudo' and 'sudo_user' directives. Add a cap to make 2.3.6 the latest
installed version to unblock gate testing without requiring additional
changes to the Kilo branch.

Change-Id: Id83c6ee7263b56724f5ffed3aa951a48bdaa3296

subject: Do not set Swift parameters defaults in keyword arguments
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-12 09:12:02.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_inspector/test/test_swift.py', 'releasenotes/notes/extra-hardware-swift-aeebf299b9605bb0.yaml', 'ironic_inspector/common/swift.py'], 'message': "Do not set Swift parameters defaults in keyword arguments

The configuration values are not initialized at the moment of import,
so it has no effect. The only reason we didn't hit it is due to helper
functions overriding the arguments. But extra_hardware plugin does not work.

Change-Id: If23bbdc4162589707cd63e6446a92036436b7f2a
Closes-Bug: #1544613
"}]
commit_message:
Do not set Swift parameters defaults in keyword arguments

The configuration values are not initialized at the moment of import,
so it has no effect. The only reason we didn't hit it is due to helper
functions overriding the arguments. But extra_hardware plugin does not work.

Change-Id: If23bbdc4162589707cd63e6446a92036436b7f2a
Closes-Bug: #1544613

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-09 12:31:23.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_convg_stack.py', 'heat/engine/stack.py'], 'message': 'Convergence: Consider resources from old template

While selecting best existing resource from DB, we select the resource
only if it belongs to current or previous template.
But in case of multiple concurrent updates, we could still have the
candidate resource from old template. Hence do not ignore them.

Change-Id: I33243a12aca43242825a256dde2c2969ddb5ef73
Closes-Bug: #1495544
'}]
commit_message:
Convergence: Consider resources from old template

While selecting best existing resource from DB, we select the resource
only if it belongs to current or previous template.
But in case of multiple concurrent updates, we could still have the
candidate resource from old template. Hence do not ignore them.

Change-Id: I33243a12aca43242825a256dde2c2969ddb5ef73
Closes-Bug: #1495544

subject: Adds os-win to the openstack-projects libraries list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-18 17:39:41.000000000', 'files': ['www/developer/openstack-projects.html'], 'message': 'Adds os-win to the openstack-projects libraries list

os-win is a python library for OpenStack projects. The library contains
Windows / Hyper-V code commonly used in the OpenStack projects: nova,
cinder, networking-hyperv. The library can be used in any other
OpenStack projects where it is needed.

Change-Id: I0039e79e484f442b3df8d98a1540e8676305724e
'}]
commit_message:
Adds os-win to the openstack-projects libraries list

os-win is a python library for OpenStack projects. The library contains
Windows / Hyper-V code commonly used in the OpenStack projects: nova,
cinder, networking-hyperv. The library can be used in any other
OpenStack projects where it is needed.

Change-Id: I0039e79e484f442b3df8d98a1540e8676305724e

commit_message:
Add 'is_protected' field to all default templates

To keep the initial update/delete semantics the same for
default templates after changes to 'is_default',
we need to add '"is_protected": true' to all of the
templates bundled with sahara.

Change-Id: If52d68f4b99fdab1bc2b61fc10c4bfa2730d242b
Partial-implements: blueprint replace-is-default

commit_message:
Enable statistic sending in system tests

- Remove CENTOS_7 conditions from setup_environment method
- Change force_fuel_stats_sending logic because statsenderd.log
was re-created after systemctl restart in 2-3 seconds
- Add 2 waits to check_oswl_stat method because after systemctl restart
resource was added to db in 2-3 seconds
- Add wait and retry for sending statistic because sometimes
after restarting statsenderd stat wasn't sent

Change-Id: Ib6f0d980ab26a4282fa9cb64315413de73d2db1b
Closes-Bug: #1543081

commit_message:
Change 'ignore_default' to 'ignore_prot_on_def'

With the change of semantics for templates with
'is_default' and 'is_protected' set, this flag
should be changed everywhere to have a more
appropriate name.

Change-Id: Ifc913e34e94dc59604f733c991858e7011bd728f
Partial-implements: blueprint replace-is-default

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-25 15:55:00.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'sahara/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/029_set_is_protected_on_is_default.py', 'sahara/tests/unit/db/migration/test_migrations.py', 'sahara/tests/unit/conductor/manager/test_templates.py'], 'message': "Remove overlap of 'is_default' and 'is_protected' for templates

The 'is_default' field remains as a marker for default templates
so that they can be managed from the sahara-templates tool. However,
the 'is_default' field will no longer protect a default template
from deletion or update. The 'is_protected' tool should be used
for that. To ensure that existing default templates have the
same protection, a migration script is included that sets

Change-Id: I1d77eb7fe104821ad44ddb972d0bec383ee5b8de
Partial-implements: blueprint replace-is-default
"}]
commit_message:
Remove overlap of 'is_default' and 'is_protected' for templates

The 'is_default' field remains as a marker for default templates
so that they can be managed from the sahara-templates tool. However,
the 'is_default' field will no longer protect a default template
from deletion or update. The 'is_protected' tool should be used
for that. To ensure that existing default templates have the
same protection, a migration script is included that sets
'is_protected' on any curret default template.

Change-Id: I1d77eb7fe104821ad44ddb972d0bec383ee5b8de
Partial-implements: blueprint replace-is-default

subject: Ceilometer client instantiation fixup
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-11 17:31:09.000000000', 'files': ['watcher/common/clients.py', 'watcher/tests/common/test_clients.py'], 'message': "Ceilometer client instantiation fixup

A problem was found during manual integration tests which were failing
because we couldn't instantiate the ceilometer client when trying to
execute an action plan using the 'basic_consolidation' strategy.

This patchset fixes the problem with an update of the related tests

Change-Id: I2b1f1dcc16fd8dfbf508c4d5661c1fce194254e4
Closes-Bug: #1544652
"}]
commit_message:
Ceilometer client instantiation fixup

A problem was found during manual integration tests which were failing
because we couldn't instantiate the ceilometer client when trying to
execute an action plan using the 'basic_consolidation' strategy.

This patchset fixes the problem with an update of the related tests

Change-Id: I2b1f1dcc16fd8dfbf508c4d5661c1fce194254e4
Closes-Bug: #1544652

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-02-10 15:12:42.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'action/config_template.py', 'releasenotes/notes/config_template-MultiStrOps-support-c28e33fd5044e14d.yaml'], 'message': 'Add MultiStrOps support to config_template

This change adds the MultiStrOps variaable type to the config
template parsing as well as supports multi string options when
passing configuration overrides.

This is made prossible by using the set type for options found within
config overrides and creating a custom dictionary class that allows
for multiple keys to be stored as a set. When the config_template
encounters a set type it will process and reder value as a
MultiStrOps.

Set types are defined in yaml via the "?" entry.

Example Overrides:

    - 1
    - 2
  multistrops_things:
    ? a
    ? b

Example Rendered Config:
  things = 1,2
  multistrops_things = a
  multistrops_things = b

Change-Id: I2193ea2eb7f839c3151c2c96f9dfe86f141e5a15
Closes-Bug: #1542513
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add MultiStrOps support to config_template

This change adds the MultiStrOps variaable type to the config
template parsing as well as supports multi string options when
passing configuration overrides.

This is made prossible by using the set type for options found within
config overrides and creating a custom dictionary class that allows
for multiple keys to be stored as a set. When the config_template
encounters a set type it will process and reder value as a
MultiStrOps.

Set types are defined in yaml via the "?" entry.

Example Overrides:
  things:
    - 1
    - 2
  multistrops_things:
    ? a
    ? b

Example Rendered Config:
  things = 1,2
  multistrops_things = a
  multistrops_things = b

Change-Id: I2193ea2eb7f839c3151c2c96f9dfe86f141e5a15
Closes-Bug: #1542513
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Adds better logging to the domain config finder

There was no feedback for files that did't match the pattern at all. So
if you had a config keystone.domain.confg (because of a mistype) you
wouldn't get feedback saying that your config was or wasn't being used.

Change-Id: I53b446d0413bd1acda420626d4a7e111e4b97f4f
Related-Bug: 1472059

commit_message:
Extracts logic for finding domain configs

The logic for finding configs shouldn't be mixed up with the logic for
procssing those configs. This refactoring also allows the logic to be
more easily mocked.

Change-Id: Ie5ec034bca72d61e0b4de63e480be06959ee8583
Related-Bug: 1472059

commit_message:
Remove redundant database sync action

As of versions 7.0 and 8.0, database sync for nailgun and keystone
DBs are performed at startup of respective docker containers.

Remove the call that performs redundant sync for those databases.

Blueprint: create-standalone-script-to-backup-masternode

subject: import release-test repository
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-10 21:03:02.000000000', 'files': ['gerritbot/channels.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'gerrit/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "import release-test repository

The release team wants to have a repository to test changes to the
release tools against, instead of using real releases from real
projects. This repo will serve as a dummy project that we can use for
testing releases, announcements, etc. without risking creating a bad
release of something real.

The permissions are set to let anyone with access to the release-tools
repository to modify this new repository. We don't need a new gerrit ACL
group for this repo.

Change-Id: I5c490dbd660bcea29b2b655d9f2e8131c346ecdb
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
import release-test repository

The release team wants to have a repository to test changes to the
release tools against, instead of using real releases from real
projects. This repo will serve as a dummy project that we can use for
testing releases, announcements, etc. without risking creating a bad
release of something real.

The permissions are set to let anyone with access to the release-tools
repository to modify this new repository. We don't need a new gerrit ACL
group for this repo.

Change-Id: I5c490dbd660bcea29b2b655d9f2e8131c346ecdb
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add a tinyIPA non-voting test to Ironic

TinyIPA is a small tinycorelinux based IPA image that Ironic is
considering using instead of the coreos image, this patch adds a
non-voting test to the Ironic check pipeline to start the ball rolling.
This change depends on tinyipa merging into the ironic-python-agent
project, as well as an update to the ironic devstack plugin.

Change-Id: Ibfcd715538275ee0278fd392dad80f7341890951
Depends-On: I79fbec75de19b3d6feb19f87a3a0f662eae42bf3
Depends-On: If45c36cb8dc267dc80d1a324e8db3286ba6f7ee8

commit_message:
Adding domain parameters to openrc file

From Kilo release of Openstack we are using domains. To run any
openstack command we require project and user domain names to be
exported to environment. Added OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME and
OS_USER_DOMAIN_NAME values to openrc file.
Closes-Bug: #1534901

Change-Id: I807838200d6ebe87e942e9a3603f25c49c2cabae

commit_message:
Add job gate-swift-tox-func-in-process-fast-post

Adds non-voting gate-swift-tox-func-in-process-fast-post.

The new 'func-in-process-fast-post' tox env tests
swift using an alternative configuration to increase
test coverage. A new env is used rather than changing
the definition of the current 'func' env because some
developers use the 'func' env for local testing.

The new job is non-voting until it is proven stable.

Depends-On: Ia37f6df1dc38e44ef7404fbf0a52f6fc22fae0c2
Change-Id: Ibdd5f8a8201ce377e73f88892d7a42c81d1f5d8d

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-01-28 14:48:22.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.pp', 'elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template'], 'message': 'Set default Glance backend to Swift

This patch configures glance to use Swift as the default
backend for image storage. The 'file' backend is
still available (listed in known stores) so that users
who upgrade will still have access to those images.

The motivation for this change is to be able to load
images directly from Swift into the IPA deployment
ramdisk (via a swift temp URL). In the future...
say once we have support for "external swift"
in instack undercloud one could imagine using this feature
to offload most of the image deployment traffic from
the instack deployment vm/server entirely by relying
on an external swift cluster.

Change-Id: If57520cbc8ec2caa7a9cb3796419648318e5e414
'}]
commit_message:
Set default Glance backend to Swift

This patch configures glance to use Swift as the default
backend for image storage. The 'file' backend is
still available (listed in known stores) so that users
who upgrade will still have access to those images.

The motivation for this change is to be able to load
images directly from Swift into the IPA deployment
ramdisk (via a swift temp URL). In the future...
say once we have support for "external swift"
in instack undercloud one could imagine using this feature
to offload most of the image deployment traffic from
the instack deployment vm/server entirely by relying
on an external swift cluster.

Change-Id: If57520cbc8ec2caa7a9cb3796419648318e5e414

commit_message:
config options: Centralise 'virt.driver' options

Add options from 'virt.driver'. These options are part of the
'DEFAULT' group but are included in the "nova.conf.virt" file in hope
that they can eventually be moved to their own group.

Change-Id: Icf6084c156c4990ac60c778c28a48ae5ab97273a
Implements: bp centralize-config-options

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-01-13 06:47:01.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/engine/service/test_service_engine.py', 'heat/engine/service.py'], 'message': "Set DB max_overflow to match thread pool size

Set max_overflow config option of database to match the number of
workers that can be spawned simultaneously. The maximum number of RPC
workers that can be spawned is determined by executor_thread_pool_size
config option.

This ensures there won't be lack of DB sessions when many worker
threads/eventlets are spawned when the engine is under load.

The DB connections that are part of overflow bucket are closed
automatically when they are not in use, so heat doesn't run out of
'lsof' limit.

Closes-Bug: #1491185
Change-Id: I4fcfe50b53b4d476f7483bb860667c42d0c54a19
"}]
commit_message:
Set DB max_overflow to match thread pool size

Set max_overflow config option of database to match the number of
workers that can be spawned simultaneously. The maximum number of RPC
workers that can be spawned is determined by executor_thread_pool_size
config option.

This ensures there won't be lack of DB sessions when many worker
threads/eventlets are spawned when the engine is under load.

The DB connections that are part of overflow bucket are closed
automatically when they are not in use, so heat doesn't run out of
'lsof' limit.

Closes-Bug: #1491185
Change-Id: I4fcfe50b53b4d476f7483bb860667c42d0c54a19

subject: Change reqirements forcing cliff != 1.16.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-10 09:23:57.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': "Change reqirements forcing cliff != 1.16.0

Cliff 1.16.0 won't work on Windows since it
tries to use fcntl.ioctl that is not available on
Windows (Bug report on cliff: #1543958).
Thus, the neutron client will not work on Windows
if it uses cliff 1.16.0.

This change proposes to change the requirements
to force a version different than 1.16.0.

Change-Id: I4046ac4d1a68e22052d46485f094612166db2f28
"}]
commit_message:
Change reqirements forcing cliff != 1.16.0

Cliff 1.16.0 won't work on Windows since it
tries to use fcntl.ioctl that is not available on
Windows (Bug report on cliff: #1543958).
Thus, the neutron client will not work on Windows
if it uses cliff 1.16.0.

This change proposes to change the requirements
to force a version different than 1.16.0.

Change-Id: I4046ac4d1a68e22052d46485f094612166db2f28

subject: Changes aggregator transformer to allow retention_time w/o size
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-11 23:41:51.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/unit/transformer/test_conversions.py', 'ceilometer/tests/pipeline_base.py', 'ceilometer/transformer/conversions.py', 'ceilometer/tests/unit/transformer/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Changes aggregator transformer to allow retention_time w/o size

When using an aggregator transformer in pipeline.yaml that
looks like this:
---
transformers:
    - name: "aggregator"
      parameters:
          retention_time: 60
          resource_metadata: last
---
'size' will automatically be defaulted to 1. That means that
aggregation will not happen as expected with a retention_time of
60 seconds.

This fix will only default sample size to 1 if neither
retention_time or size are defined.

Change-Id: I4a3aa0f6de26173e6f9383d570ff2cf13d367e38
Closes-Bug: 1531626
(cherry picked from commit 5a9a41563e9c26fb91f4d5ebf863bf24bf395237)
'}]
commit_message:
Changes aggregator transformer to allow retention_time w/o size

When using an aggregator transformer in pipeline.yaml that
looks like this:
---
transformers:
    - name: "aggregator"
      parameters:
          retention_time: 60
          resource_metadata: last
---
'size' will automatically be defaulted to 1. That means that
aggregation will not happen as expected with a retention_time of
60 seconds.

This fix will only default sample size to 1 if neither
retention_time or size are defined.

Change-Id: I4a3aa0f6de26173e6f9383d570ff2cf13d367e38
Closes-Bug: 1531626
(cherry picked from commit 5a9a41563e9c26fb91f4d5ebf863bf24bf395237)

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-02-10 16:05:38.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/api/extensions.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/api/test_extensions.py', 'neutron/plugins/common/constants.py', 'neutron/manager.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_manager.py', 'releasenotes/notes/add-get-me-a-network-56321aeef5389001.yaml', 'setup.cfg', 'neutron/tests/base.py'], 'message': 'Add the ability to load a set of service plugins on startup

Service plugins are a great way of adding functionality in a
cohesive way. Some plugins (e.g. network ip availability or
auto_allocate) extend the capabilities of the Neutron server
by being completely orthogonal to the core plugin, and yet may
be considered an integral part of functionality available in
any Neutron deployment. For this reason, it makes sense to
include them seamlessly in the service plugin loading process.

This patch, in particular, introduces the 'auto_allocate' service
plugin for default loading, as we'd want this feature to be enabled
for Nova to use irrespective of the chosen underlying core plugin.

The feature requires subnetpools, external_net and router, while
the first is part of the core, the others can be plugin specific
and they must be explicitly advertised. That said, they all are
features that any deployment can hardly live without.

DocImpact: The "get-me-a-network" feature simplifies the process
for launching an instance with basic network connectivity (via an
externally connected private tenant network).

Once leveraged by Nova, a tenant/admin is no longer required to
provision networking resources ahead of boot process in order to
successfully launch an instance.

Implements: blueprint get-me-a-network

Change-Id: Ia35e8a946bf0ac0bb085cde46b675d17b0bb2f51
'}]
commit_message:
Add the ability to load a set of service plugins on startup

Service plugins are a great way of adding functionality in a
cohesive way. Some plugins (e.g. network ip availability or
auto_allocate) extend the capabilities of the Neutron server
by being completely orthogonal to the core plugin, and yet may
be considered an integral part of functionality available in
any Neutron deployment. For this reason, it makes sense to
include them seamlessly in the service plugin loading process.

This patch, in particular, introduces the 'auto_allocate' service
plugin for default loading, as we'd want this feature to be enabled
for Nova to use irrespective of the chosen underlying core plugin.

The feature requires subnetpools, external_net and router, while
the first is part of the core, the others can be plugin specific
and they must be explicitly advertised. That said, they all are
features that any deployment can hardly live without.

DocImpact: The "get-me-a-network" feature simplifies the process
for launching an instance with basic network connectivity (via an
externally connected private tenant network).

Once leveraged by Nova, a tenant/admin is no longer required to
provision networking resources ahead of boot process in order to
successfully launch an instance.

Implements: blueprint get-me-a-network

Change-Id: Ia35e8a946bf0ac0bb085cde46b675d17b0bb2f51

commit_message:
Added GreenAsyncPile txn_id logging

This commit adds threads local to GreenAsyncPile to log
transaction id.

Added partial bug tag because in bug description a more relevant
fix is suggested which would fix the bug completely but for
now this makes sense to add this commit for logging.

Change-Id: I34b684cbafba51d9aa3ba624226d88799cc2ad96
Partial-Bug: #1409302

commit_message:
Remove 'external=True' in Huawei driver

The 'call' function in Huawei driver use a progress
level lock, this can be replaced with thread level lock.

Closes-Bug: #1536015
Change-Id: Ie8d39164c78b886e3253497ab0936254c586f016

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-02-10 15:45:42.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/1500-default-mtu-b0d6e4ab193b62a4.yaml', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/config.py'], 'message': "ML2: Configure path_mtu to default to 1500 bytes

I8287677c7ad0f13fa9f5cb194f9372d04b78cb61 changed the behavior of
DevStack, so that path_mtu is being set to 1500 by default. Let's take
the next step and set path_mtu to 1500 by default, instead of relying on
deployment tools like DevStack to set it.

When using the ML2 plugin and setting path_mtu to default to 1500,
the second order effect is that all Neutron
Network objects will have the mtu attribute populated. For tenant
network types like VXLAN, the MTU will be set as path_mtu less the
protocol overhead. So for example, a Neutron Network backed by VXLAN
will have the mtu attribute set to 1450.

Related-Bug: #1542108
Co-Authored-By: Matt Kassawara <mkassawara@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I4096a3e7704032fa4aa5c3aa8bcaec4e38d0d06d
"}]
commit_message:
ML2: Configure path_mtu to default to 1500 bytes

I8287677c7ad0f13fa9f5cb194f9372d04b78cb61 changed the behavior of
DevStack, so that path_mtu is being set to 1500 by default. Let's take
the next step and set path_mtu to 1500 by default, instead of relying on
deployment tools like DevStack to set it.

When using the ML2 plugin and setting path_mtu to default to 1500,
the second order effect is that all Neutron
Network objects will have the mtu attribute populated. For tenant
network types like VXLAN, the MTU will be set as path_mtu less the
protocol overhead. So for example, a Neutron Network backed by VXLAN
will have the mtu attribute set to 1450.

Related-Bug: #1542108
Co-Authored-By: Matt Kassawara <mkassawara@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I4096a3e7704032fa4aa5c3aa8bcaec4e38d0d06d

commit_message:
[config-ref] Add hmac_keys option in cinder.conf

In this patch, I have added about how we can get the latest
conf file because now the cinder using tox to generate it
which internally include newly added option hmac_keys

Change-Id: I1c7ba86ec069c297d3bb94af8f70b3e799a46d78
Closes-Bug: #1529720

commit_message:
Place exports for dsvm-integration job into a separate file

This will allow us to modify devstack environment of a
dsvm-integration job independently of infra repository, once
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/269578/ is merged. This is a
preparation to integration testing of Heat-enabled panel in Horizon,
since Heat is disabled in Devstack by default.

Change-Id: Id9ab8e846c33921e1c55e459056345c8d14204fd
