commit_message:
Image Detail Redesign (Angular/UX)

Image Detail UX redesign, implemented in AngularJS.  This uses the design
at http://invis.io/962Q35HVQ as its base.  For now, basic properties are
displayed.

The actions on the detail screen will be implemented in a later patch.

To test, modify openstack_dashboard/enabled/_1051_project_ng_images_panel.py
and set DISABLED = False

There's a bug around translation of images which is introduced
by this change https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1487590

Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-images-table

Co-Authored-By: Rajat Vig <rajatv@thoughtworks.com>
Co-Authored-By: Dan Siwiec <dan.siwiec@thoughtworks.com>
Co-Authored-By: Kyle Olivo <kyle@kyleolivo.com>
Co-Authored-By: Coleman Beasley <coleman.beasley@thoughtworks.com>
Co-Authored-By: Matt Borland <matt.borland@hpe.com>
Co-Authored-By: Tyr Johanson <tyr@hpe.com>

Change-Id: I9882970b40b52a402e5693f6993f1b50c0a819f6

commit_message:
Container Loader Image now Themable

The Container was still using the old loading.gif, which is a static
file that cannot be made themable. Now, just like the pending table
actions, it uses the bootstrap progress bar, thus making it theme
compliant, and now we can completely remove that gif from the code
base.

Change-Id: I382078e9f07084ef723c8d3dbdc8114e1467d46c
Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-theme-css-reorg
Partially-Implements: blueprint bootstrap-html-standards

commit_message:
Add volume type encryption update

This patch adds support to horizon for volume type encryption
update.

The modifications are made to the Admin Volume Type table, and
add the Update Encryption action to the action column.

Implements: blueprint integration-with-cinder-volume-encryption
Change-Id: I7b6f1db60818a07feb64eaa464e64397ea477a7b

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-02-09 21:03:27.000000000', 'files': ['go/objectserver/main.go', 'go/middleware/grep.go', 'go/middleware/grep_test.go'], 'message': 'go: GREP middleware

This middleware adds support for grepping objects in-place using the GREP
method and the "e" query parameter.  "e" was chosen go match grep(1).  Other
grep parameters may be implemented later if needed.
It detects gzip and bzip2 files and decompresses them inline.
This is intended to allow backend tools to search log files.

Example:

    GREP /sda/123/account/container/object?e=SEARCH HTTP/1.1

Change-Id: I569a72f4fc0f8ab85b90e8677f6daff0e28e8a79
'}]
commit_message:
go: GREP middleware

This middleware adds support for grepping objects in-place using the GREP
method and the "e" query parameter.  "e" was chosen go match grep(1).  Other
grep parameters may be implemented later if needed.
It detects gzip and bzip2 files and decompresses them inline.
This is intended to allow backend tools to search log files.

Example:

    GREP /sda/123/account/container/object?e=SEARCH HTTP/1.1

Change-Id: I569a72f4fc0f8ab85b90e8677f6daff0e28e8a79

subject: Add -constraints for CI jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-17 05:24:56.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Add -constraints for CI jobs

This adds the constraints factor to the base section and duplicates
the sections required for CI with -constraints as tox does not
currently support factors in sections.  Work towards enabling factor
support in sections is currently stalled, as such we will need to
duplicate sections adding -constraints to facilitate running sections
with the constrained install_command.

Implements Blueprint: Requirements-Management

Change-Id: I39a411741b78095c291a7627df24d75d643f1e52
'}]
commit_message:
Add -constraints for CI jobs

This adds the constraints factor to the base section and duplicates
the sections required for CI with -constraints as tox does not
currently support factors in sections.  Work towards enabling factor
support in sections is currently stalled, as such we will need to
duplicate sections adding -constraints to facilitate running sections
with the constrained install_command.

Implements Blueprint: Requirements-Management

Change-Id: I39a411741b78095c291a7627df24d75d643f1e52

commit_message:
Add an implementation for validate_connector

The VMEM FCP driver does not implement validate_connector. This patch
implements the default version of the function so that CI tests will no
longer fail.

Closes-Bug: #1543311

Change-Id: If1bb3081d9aa3107beb832d79111ad56febcbcc4

commit_message:
Allow parameter expansion in endpoint_override

Allow %(project_id)s and %(user_id)s in an endpoint_override string to
be replaced with the appropriate values from the authentication. This
makes it easier to use and specify overrides from the command line or
scripts where we may not know the project_id/user_id ahead of time.

Change-Id: Ia09f5a88cb6590113dab26796c58e708014e98f7
Closes-Bug: #1536874

subject: Define has_neutron_plugin_security_group using override-defaults
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-13 14:24:59.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/override-defaults', 'devstack/midonet/functions'], 'message': 'Define has_neutron_plugin_security_group using override-defaults

DevStack now privides a mechanism to define methods before loading
lib/*. Previously has_neutron_plugin_security_group is used before
an external DevStack plugin is loaded, so we need to define this
method in the master DevStack repo. Now we can define this method
by using the override-defaults mechanism. This allows us to remove
a plugin-specific definition from the master DevStack repo.

Needed-By: I37d5012e89cb3650e4f325b6d77d70f28f87d3e7
Change-Id: I5e02acd288e53dd06a369d348ec77ead57d476fd
'}]
commit_message:
Define has_neutron_plugin_security_group using override-defaults

DevStack now privides a mechanism to define methods before loading
lib/*. Previously has_neutron_plugin_security_group is used before
an external DevStack plugin is loaded, so we need to define this
method in the master DevStack repo. Now we can define this method
by using the override-defaults mechanism. This allows us to remove
a plugin-specific definition from the master DevStack repo.

Needed-By: I37d5012e89cb3650e4f325b6d77d70f28f87d3e7
Change-Id: I5e02acd288e53dd06a369d348ec77ead57d476fd

If the logging of an HTTP request causes a UnicodeDecodeError,
modify the log entry using oslo_utils.encodeutils.safe_decode
with errors='replace' and try again

Co-Authored-By: Nikita Konovalov <nkonovalov@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: Ic365c654ebca4045208c6c30e232665145db7b4c
Closes-Bug: #1453953
"}]
commit_message:
Handle exception on UnicodeDecodError in logging of request

If the logging of an HTTP request causes a UnicodeDecodeError,
modify the log entry using oslo_utils.encodeutils.safe_decode
with errors='replace' and try again

Co-Authored-By: Nikita Konovalov <nkonovalov@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: Ic365c654ebca4045208c6c30e232665145db7b4c
Closes-Bug: #1453953

subject: Add scale_config column to the app table
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-10 15:33:05.000000000', 'files': ['solum/objects/sqlalchemy/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/a271b35952be_add_scale_config_to_app_table.py', 'solum/objects/sqlalchemy/app.py'], 'message': "Add scale_config column to the app table

Adding a column named scale_config to the app table.
The idea is to use it to store an app's scaling related
configuration. The type of the column is set to text, so that
we can store any required information in this column.
For now, the plan is to store following info in json format:

{<app-name>: {target: m, current: n, du: du-name/du-id}}, where

app-name is the app-name

m is the number of target instances requested in the most
recent scaling operation.

n is the number of actual instances running after the most
recent scaling operation has been completed.

n <= m relation will always hold.

du-name/du-id is the name/id of the application du that
should be used in the scaling operation.

This column will also allow us to support multi-service
applications in the future. Lets say we have an app with
two services - web and backend. The scaling configuration
for both can be stored as follows.

{web: {target: w_m, current: w_n, du: w_du},
 backend: {target: b_m, current: b_n, du: b_du}
}

Change-Id: I94e41c0953faa1f5d51defa3d4ccf33384f58135
Closes-Bug: #1541467
"}]
commit_message:
Add scale_config column to the app table

Adding a column named scale_config to the app table.
The idea is to use it to store an app's scaling related
configuration. The type of the column is set to text, so that
we can store any required information in this column.
For now, the plan is to store following info in json format:

{<app-name>: {target: m, current: n, du: du-name/du-id}}, where

app-name is the app-name

m is the number of target instances requested in the most
recent scaling operation.

n is the number of actual instances running after the most
recent scaling operation has been completed.

n <= m relation will always hold.

du-name/du-id is the name/id of the application du that
should be used in the scaling operation.

This column will also allow us to support multi-service
applications in the future. Lets say we have an app with
two services - web and backend. The scaling configuration
for both can be stored as follows.

{web: {target: w_m, current: w_n, du: w_du},
 backend: {target: b_m, current: b_n, du: b_du}
}

Change-Id: I94e41c0953faa1f5d51defa3d4ccf33384f58135
Closes-Bug: #1541467

commit_message:
Do not remove python-dev from ironic-agent image

While it does save 1MiB of space, it might also pull python packages
depending on it. E.g. it makes impossible to install python-hardware
on the IPA image for advanced introspection.

Change-Id: Iab80dde63e6de62a5e45dcf404b4f9f633e50ac3

subject: Fix startup race with growroot/systemd
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-10 03:04:48.000000000', 'files': ['elements/growroot/init-scripts/systemd/growroot.service'], 'message': 'Fix startup race with growroot/systemd

Tucked away in systemd-udev-settle.service is the following comment

 # This service can dynamically be pulled-in by legacy services which
 # cannot reliably cope with dynamic device configurations, and
 # wrongfully expect a populated /dev during bootup.

The info that the growroot script is querying is populated via udev,
particularly the blkid bits of [1].  This creates a race-condition
where sometimes udev has been triggered and the rules have applied and
sometimes not.  Obviously in the first case, the root disk is not
grown correctly.

systemd-udev-settle is mostly disabled on distros because it can cause
an increase in boot-time for systems with lots of disks; this is not
our situation so it makes basically no difference.

That said, I will investigate if some systemd people know even better
ways to do this (possibly the service should depend on block .device
targets in systemd, and then filter out and only apply to the root
disk?)

[1] https://github.com/systemd/systemd/blob/master/rules/60-persistent-storage.rules#L66

Change-Id: I453e3afcd953dfc29ab6c42ddc81e940cfa70ee0
'}]
commit_message:
Fix startup race with growroot/systemd

Tucked away in systemd-udev-settle.service is the following comment

 # This service can dynamically be pulled-in by legacy services which
 # cannot reliably cope with dynamic device configurations, and
 # wrongfully expect a populated /dev during bootup.

The info that the growroot script is querying is populated via udev,
particularly the blkid bits of [1].  This creates a race-condition
where sometimes udev has been triggered and the rules have applied and
sometimes not.  Obviously in the first case, the root disk is not
grown correctly.

systemd-udev-settle is mostly disabled on distros because it can cause
an increase in boot-time for systems with lots of disks; this is not
our situation so it makes basically no difference.

That said, I will investigate if some systemd people know even better
ways to do this (possibly the service should depend on block .device
targets in systemd, and then filter out and only apply to the root
disk?)

[1] https://github.com/systemd/systemd/blob/master/rules/60-persistent-storage.rules#L66

Change-Id: I453e3afcd953dfc29ab6c42ddc81e940cfa70ee0

subject: Remove except Exception handler
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-16 03:42:48.000000000', 'files': ['keystonemiddleware/tests/unit/auth_token/test_auth_token_middleware.py', 'keystonemiddleware/auth_token/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Remove except Exception handler

Our except Exception handler catches any passing exception and turns it
into a webob 500 error. However the default behaviour of uncaught
exceptions is to be rendered as 500 errors with actual debug output so
all we are doing is masking useful failure stack traces.

Removed the only exception that triggered this case. For offline token
validation we really should know all the types of exception that can be
raised and handle them.

Change-Id: I89d84a60b76c7a7e08e3eb453b1880b064983fbf
'}]
commit_message:
Remove except Exception handler

Our except Exception handler catches any passing exception and turns it
into a webob 500 error. However the default behaviour of uncaught
exceptions is to be rendered as 500 errors with actual debug output so
all we are doing is masking useful failure stack traces.

Removed the only exception that triggered this case. For offline token
validation we really should know all the types of exception that can be
raised and handle them.

Change-Id: I89d84a60b76c7a7e08e3eb453b1880b064983fbf

commit_message:
Removing Keystone middleware configurations in neutron paste file

Keystone auth configurations are being added to neutron.conf and
api-paste.ini both files, which leads to duplication of auth
configurations.
If we change the keystone auth configurations in neutron.conf,
still they wont be reflected as in api-paste.ini there are
previous details.
To get away from this issue removed keystone configurations
 in api-paste.ini
Closes-Bug: #1513532

Change-Id: I2221a0de0ce46e8f4765d78700bec31577870181

commit_message:
Correct opt type for nexenta_chunksize/blocksize

When defined as a string with an integer default value, configuration
generation fails. Set to IntOpt based on help description and 4K/16K
values.

Change-Id: Ifaa92e15e3af837d87f71190702e66245c0fe7df

subject: Remove server queue creating if target's server is empty
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-02-11 15:42:20.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/pika_driver/pika_message.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/pika_driver/pika_poller.py'], 'message': "Remove server queue creating if target's server is empty

If target passed to MessageHandlerServer doesn't contain server,
It is not needed to create queue for server.
Also this patch removes mandatory flag for sending message during fanout
cast because is is possible to cast fanout messages when nobody listen
queue and this situation is ok.

Change-Id: I4f8930e7b939c62bc1e97b4acaba6884fe1b97b2
"}]
commit_message:
Remove server queue creating if target's server is empty

If target passed to MessageHandlerServer doesn't contain server,
It is not needed to create queue for server.
Also this patch removes mandatory flag for sending message during fanout
cast because is is possible to cast fanout messages when nobody listen
queue and this situation is ok.

Change-Id: I4f8930e7b939c62bc1e97b4acaba6884fe1b97b2

subject: Make handoffs_first a more useful "mode"
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-25 23:29:34.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/replicator.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_replicator.py'], 'message': 'Make handoffs_first a more useful "mode"

Based on experience using handoffs_first and feedback from other
operators it has become clear that handoffs_first is only used during
periods of problematic cluster behavior (e.g. full disks) when
replication attempts are failing to quickly drain off the partitions
from the nodes which they have been rebalanced from.

In order to focus on the most important work (getting handoff partitions
off the node) handoffs_first mode will abort the current replication
sweep before attempting any primary suffix syncing if any of the handoff
partitions were not removed for any reason - and start over with
replication of handoffs jobs as the highest priority.

Note that handoffs_first being enabled will emit a warning on start up,
even if no handoff jobs fail, because of the negative impact it can have
during normal operations by dog piling on a node that was temporarily
unavailable.

Change-Id: Ia324728d42c606e2f9e7d29b4ab5fcbff6e47aea
'}]
commit_message:
Make handoffs_first a more useful "mode"

Based on experience using handoffs_first and feedback from other
operators it has become clear that handoffs_first is only used during
periods of problematic cluster behavior (e.g. full disks) when
replication attempts are failing to quickly drain off the partitions
from the nodes which they have been rebalanced from.

In order to focus on the most important work (getting handoff partitions
off the node) handoffs_first mode will abort the current replication
sweep before attempting any primary suffix syncing if any of the handoff
partitions were not removed for any reason - and start over with
replication of handoffs jobs as the highest priority.

Note that handoffs_first being enabled will emit a warning on start up,
even if no handoff jobs fail, because of the negative impact it can have
during normal operations by dog piling on a node that was temporarily
unavailable.

Change-Id: Ia324728d42c606e2f9e7d29b4ab5fcbff6e47aea

commit_message:
Remove access_mode 'rw' setting in drivers

The volume manager sets the initiator access mode in
initialize_connection, so drivers should not hardcode
this setting to 'rw'. This patch removes code from drivers
that override the access_mode.

Change-Id: I634cb914635ee90114a511f942c4d7be51d7a36d
Closes-bug: #1526152

subject: Clarify Ansible installation for distros in docs.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-12 01:41:56.000000000', 'files': ['doc/quickstart.rst'], 'message': 'Clarify Ansible installation for distros in docs.

For CentOS, install from distro packaging by default.  Explain
how to install on DEB based systems from packaging when they
update to a newer version of Ansible.  Finally, clean up the
ordering of the dependencies for a pip based install.

TrivialFix

commit_message:
Clarify Ansible installation for distros in docs.

For CentOS, install from distro packaging by default.  Explain
how to install on DEB based systems from packaging when they
update to a newer version of Ansible.  Finally, clean up the
ordering of the dependencies for a pip based install.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I9564a03c2e75fd30b5ec9c7d64f5defb709d7fde

commit_message:
Add openstack client resource type list and show

Add the openstack orchestration resource type and show
commands. Included support for the optional generation of
the output in hot or cfn formats.

Based from the existing heat commands:
   heat resource-type-list
   heat resource-type-show
   heat resource-type-template

commit_message:
Remove trace back from server responses.

According to recent api-wg guidelines [1], server side trace backs are
never supposed to be returned to client users.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/183599/

Change-Id: I6b0ae41e43cf0bf01c7273e2b7f5ab942bdc57d8

commit_message:
fix free_gb value when scheduler receives None from compute

When Null free_gb is received about compute at scheduler and
it tries to convert it to MB , it errors out due to Nonetype
multiplication with integer.

Closes-Bug: #1517770
Change-Id: Icf3b61e7c6dbf400a05ec622181d8f312d90a608

subject: Actually prune stale branches in src-repos
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 6488, 'name': 'Clint Byrum', 'email': 'clint@fewbar.com', 'username': 'clint-fewbar'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 9369, 'name': 'Steve Kowalik', 'email': 'steven@wedontsleep.org', 'username': 'stevenk'}, {'_account_id': 10035, 'name': 'greghaynes', 'email': 'greg@greghaynes.net', 'username': 'greghaynes'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-18 20:21:25.000000000', 'files': ['elements/source-repositories/extra-data.d/98-source-repositories'], 'message': 'Actually prune stale branches in src-repos

The source-repositories element attempted to prune stale branches from
the local cache repos but failed because it was fetching specific refs
instead of updating remote tracking branches. Address this by performing
an explicit `git remote update --prune` prior to other git operations,
then comparing the list of local branches to the list of remote
branches. Any branch that is present locally but not on any remote will
be deleted.

This has the side effect of fetching refs early, short circuiting much
of the "fetch the ref we need" code in this element. That code is left
in place as there may be corner cases where a git remote update will not
fetch the ref that we want requiring us to be more explicit.

Change-Id: Ie143a1e94f0be6bf464e20bd9d978aed9868b629
'}]
commit_message:
Actually prune stale branches in src-repos

The source-repositories element attempted to prune stale branches from
the local cache repos but failed because it was fetching specific refs
instead of updating remote tracking branches. Address this by performing
an explicit `git remote update --prune` prior to other git operations,
then comparing the list of local branches to the list of remote
branches. Any branch that is present locally but not on any remote will
be deleted.

This has the side effect of fetching refs early, short circuiting much
of the "fetch the ref we need" code in this element. That code is left
in place as there may be corner cases where a git remote update will not
fetch the ref that we want requiring us to be more explicit.

Change-Id: Ie143a1e94f0be6bf464e20bd9d978aed9868b629

subject: run py34 tests before py27 to work around testr bug
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-10 20:37:00.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "run py34 tests before py27 to work around testr bug

testr uses anydbm to create a database, but python 3 dropped support for
the database format that is the default in python 2. The default for
python 3 is available under python 2, so if we run the python 3 tests
before the python 2 tests everything works fine. Change the order in the
default environment list so that if someone checks out the repo and runs
'tox' all of the tests work.

Change-Id: I44b23add5acc297ca00d2d3c7747f0cfff85cc2f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
run py34 tests before py27 to work around testr bug

testr uses anydbm to create a database, but python 3 dropped support for
the database format that is the default in python 2. The default for
python 3 is available under python 2, so if we run the python 3 tests
before the python 2 tests everything works fine. Change the order in the
default environment list so that if someone checks out the repo and runs
'tox' all of the tests work.

Change-Id: I44b23add5acc297ca00d2d3c7747f0cfff85cc2f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: stop making a copy of options discovered by config generator
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-10 20:37:00.000000000', 'files': ['osprofiler/opts.py'], 'message': "stop making a copy of options discovered by config generator

In order for the config generator's new hook for updating default values
to work, we have to return the same Opt objects from list_opts() that
our set_defaults() function is going to modify. There's no real need to
be making copies of the objects anyway, so just stop doing it.

Change-Id: I9c6149c354adc1827b773aa07bf5874981ee8b8f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
stop making a copy of options discovered by config generator

In order for the config generator's new hook for updating default values
to work, we have to return the same Opt objects from list_opts() that
our set_defaults() function is going to modify. There's no real need to
be making copies of the objects anyway, so just stop doing it.

Change-Id: I9c6149c354adc1827b773aa07bf5874981ee8b8f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Make bandit job voting
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-09 16:52:51.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Make bandit job voting

Merge bandit job into the voting pep8 target. Pep8 is used here as
general target for lint-like jobs. This will make the bandit job voting.

Looking at recent runs, bandit passes fine, so it's time to enable it.

Once this change is in, the non-voting bandit change can be removed from
OpenStack CI to reduce node usage and the entry in tox.ini can also be
removed.

Change-Id: I9bf1a741336abf830a092f0fb372116d08e6127c
"}]
commit_message:
Make bandit job voting

Merge bandit job into the voting pep8 target. Pep8 is used here as
general target for lint-like jobs. This will make the bandit job voting.

Looking at recent runs, bandit passes fine, so it's time to enable it.

Once this change is in, the non-voting bandit change can be removed from
OpenStack CI to reduce node usage and the entry in tox.ini can also be
removed.

Change-Id: I9bf1a741336abf830a092f0fb372116d08e6127c

commit_message:
Enables Row Model to Update All Rows by HTTP Request

PushedDataSourceDriver has to receive http request to update its
rows. For the updating, the driver uses existing web server for
API request.

The update requests calls API row model and the model call rpc to
PushedDriver to update row data.

Implement blueprint: push-type-datasource-driver
Change-Id: I440e6c6fe444af68ff4f728873fbced1d30450dc

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-11 13:36:21.000000000', 'files': ['extras/run-ansible-tests.sh'], 'message': 'Use release version of Ansible for testing

We were using the unreleased (from git) version of Ansible for our
Ansible test job because at the time, 2.0 had not been released. Now
that it is released, use pip to install it so that we are less likely
to get broken by development changes to Ansible.

Change-Id: Ie714f42d26569044b6a3ee761bd5fb7451833d96
'}]
commit_message:
Use release version of Ansible for testing

We were using the unreleased (from git) version of Ansible for our
Ansible test job because at the time, 2.0 had not been released. Now
that it is released, use pip to install it so that we are less likely
to get broken by development changes to Ansible.

Change-Id: Ie714f42d26569044b6a3ee761bd5fb7451833d96

subject: UnprivilegedPrivsepFixture: Clear capabilities config
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-10 04:00:13.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_privsep/tests/fixture.py'], 'message': "UnprivilegedPrivsepFixture: Clear capabilities config

When a context's 'capabilities' property was a non-empty list,
Daemon.run() would try to manipulate Linux capabilities, and fail if the
original user didn't already have (at least) these capabilities.  This
is appropriate for the regular use case, but the intention of
UnprivilegedPrivsepFixture is that it would be a no-op that works for
zero-privilege test environments.

This change clears the capabilities list (setting/expecting zero
privileges) in UnprivilegedPrivsepFixture, as was originally intended.

Change-Id: I8a0d8275877a1f9e139127049b7e234003f901ea
"}]
commit_message:
UnprivilegedPrivsepFixture: Clear capabilities config

When a context's 'capabilities' property was a non-empty list,
Daemon.run() would try to manipulate Linux capabilities, and fail if the
original user didn't already have (at least) these capabilities.  This
is appropriate for the regular use case, but the intention of
UnprivilegedPrivsepFixture is that it would be a no-op that works for
zero-privilege test environments.

This change clears the capabilities list (setting/expecting zero
privileges) in UnprivilegedPrivsepFixture, as was originally intended.

Change-Id: I8a0d8275877a1f9e139127049b7e234003f901ea

commit_message:
Make pep8 *the* linting interface

According to the PTI (=Python Test Interface,
http://governance.openstack.org/reference/cti/python_cti.html), pep8
is the interface for codestyle checks. Move all tests from linters to
pep8.

This change will be followed by a change to project-config to use pep8
for testing in the gate.

Change-Id: I1a48f4b1e0b0950640192bcfc55121619a844b50

commit_message:
Bay test cleanup

Removed some COE tests that duplicate the functional-api tests.
Consolidated duplicate code around certificates and made BayTest
always create and delete a bay so that the COE api tests can all
work off of a single bay per class.

Change-Id: I2ff7e2fd587657fb4dd171c1470c5bb208c331b5
Closes-Bug: 1544196

subject: Handle ResourceNotFound when resource is not found
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-08 06:25:15.000000000', 'files': ['senlinclient/tests/unit/v1/test_shell.py', 'senlinclient/v1/shell.py'], 'message': 'Handle ResourceNotFound when resource is not found

When creating, updating or deleting a resource which is not
existing, senlinclient desired HTTPNotFound in the current
implementation. But when server requests go to openstacksdk,
openstacksdk will convert all notfound exceptions into its
own exception type ResourceNotFound. So Senlin client should
handle this exception instead.
There is an exception when listing nodes of a cluster, ResourceNotFound
exception will be raised only when printing the output, so there is
no need to catch it when getting the nodes.

Change-Id: Ib80d749e62ed41ae07734a784d309e47c0d3fcca
'}]
commit_message:
Handle ResourceNotFound when resource is not found

When creating, updating or deleting a resource which is not
existing, senlinclient desired HTTPNotFound in the current
implementation. But when server requests go to openstacksdk,
openstacksdk will convert all notfound exceptions into its
own exception type ResourceNotFound. So Senlin client should
handle this exception instead.
There is an exception when listing nodes of a cluster, ResourceNotFound
exception will be raised only when printing the output, so there is
no need to catch it when getting the nodes.

Change-Id: Ib80d749e62ed41ae07734a784d309e47c0d3fcca

subject: Make class detection more accurate
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-09 21:43:34.000000000', 'files': ['osprofiler/profiler.py'], 'message': "Make class detection more accurate

It's more correct to use inspect.isclass(X) instead of type(X) == type
as if some parent of the class we're trying to trace has metaclass used,
the type will be that metaclass.

Change-Id: I5102eb46a7a377eca31375a0d64951ba1fdd035d
"}]
commit_message:
Make class detection more accurate

It's more correct to use inspect.isclass(X) instead of type(X) == type
as if some parent of the class we're trying to trace has metaclass used,
the type will be that metaclass.

Change-Id: I5102eb46a7a377eca31375a0d64951ba1fdd035d

commit_message:
Wire Neutron ML2 plugin and OVS agent settings as arrays

Wires the following as arrays to the neutron module:
 - mechanism_drivers
 - flat_networks
 - tenant_network_types
 - tunnel_types
 - bridge_mappings

Also updates the template version to use a Liberty feature which
allows serialization of comma_delimited_list into JSON.

Tidies up the manifests by removing the class declarations since
config is passed by the puppet/controller+compute hiera mapped_data.

This is a backport of Ie9f85fb827099f897ef750e267bc3ed3a864fe59
since the previous one was merged and then reverted in
I480ccf728024fa0a9c790d782a23f51e62948c62. Due to that, we can't reuse the same
Change-Id from master since it was already used.

Co-Authored-By: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

subject: Add script to create a subunit stream for failures before tempest
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-02 04:31:19.000000000', 'files': ['generate_subunit.py'], 'message': "Add script to create a subunit stream for failures before tempest

This commit adds a generate_subunit.py script which is used to
generate a subunit stream with a single failure for a period of time.
It takes it 2 mandatory args and 1 optional to specify the start time,
stop time, and optionally the id for test (if one isn't provided
'devstack' is used) The resulting stream is written to STDOUT.

The intent here is to leverage this to inject 'test results' into the
subunit2sql db to reflect failures that occur before tempest (or any
other test suite) is run. This is necessary for the openstack-health
dashboard. (otherwise it makes our failure rate look much better than
it is) This is only needed until we get a zuul mysql reporter in place
which can give us the higher level run information.

The actual usage of the script will be addressed in a follow-up patch.

Change-Id: I631826de7a58b2e6cb60b18d73a9fcfeca45de8f
"}]
commit_message:
Add script to create a subunit stream for failures before tempest

This commit adds a generate_subunit.py script which is used to
generate a subunit stream with a single failure for a period of time.
It takes it 2 mandatory args and 1 optional to specify the start time,
stop time, and optionally the id for test (if one isn't provided
'devstack' is used) The resulting stream is written to STDOUT.

The intent here is to leverage this to inject 'test results' into the
subunit2sql db to reflect failures that occur before tempest (or any
other test suite) is run. This is necessary for the openstack-health
dashboard. (otherwise it makes our failure rate look much better than
it is) This is only needed until we get a zuul mysql reporter in place
which can give us the higher level run information.

The actual usage of the script will be addressed in a follow-up patch.

Change-Id: I631826de7a58b2e6cb60b18d73a9fcfeca45de8f

subject: Reduce memory consumption of gate tests
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 668, 'name': 'Adrian Otto', 'email': 'aotto@aotto.com', 'username': 'aotto'}, {'_account_id': 7494, 'name': 'Guangya Liu', 'email': 'gyliu513@gmail.com', 'username': 'JayLau'}, {'_account_id': 10263, 'name': 'Vilobh Meshram', 'email': 'vilobhmm@yahoo-inc.com', 'username': 'vilobhmm'}, {'_account_id': 11536, 'name': 'hongbin', 'email': 'hongbin034@gmail.com', 'username': 'hongbin'}, {'_account_id': 11650, 'name': 'Tom Cammann', 'email': 'tom.cammann@hpe.com', 'username': 'cammann'}, {'_account_id': 12400, 'name': 'Dimitry Ushakov', 'email': 'dimitry.ushakov@rackspace.com', 'username': 'dimtruck'}, {'_account_id': 18498, 'name': "Corey O'Brien", 'email': 'coreypobrien@gmail.com', 'username': 'coreypobrien'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-02-09 19:06:06.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/tests/contrib/post_test_hook.sh', 'functional_creds.conf.sample', 'doc/source/dev/functional-test.rst', 'magnum/tests/functional/common/config.py', 'magnum/tests/functional/python_client_base.py', 'magnum/tests/functional/common/datagen.py', 'magnum/tests/functional/tempest_tests/config.py'], 'message': 'Reduce memory consumption of gate tests

Recently, the gate jobs took too long to complete (between 2 to 8
hours). The reason is jenkins slave agent die during the test, which
cause the CI to re-start the whole test in a new VM.

The failure mainly occurred at magnum-api pipeline, but also occurred
at other pipelines. In term of distribution of test nodes, this
failure mainly occurred at OVH nodes, in which there is no dedicated
swap device. As a result, at OVH nodes, local disk is used for swap
when memory is over-consuming. It looks this leads to resource
starvation, which cause the failure.

This patch attempted to reduce the memory consumption of the gate
tests. In the api test, the number of worker nodes was reduced from
2 to 1. In all tests (api/k8s/swarm/mesos), the memory of worker node
was reduced from 1G to 512M.

Closes-Bug: #1542386
Change-Id: If7822d07f95ebc935a8763b92f038f10cf07b5ca
'}]
commit_message:
Reduce memory consumption of gate tests

Recently, the gate jobs took too long to complete (between 2 to 8
hours). The reason is jenkins slave agent die during the test, which
cause the CI to re-start the whole test in a new VM.

The failure mainly occurred at magnum-api pipeline, but also occurred
at other pipelines. In term of distribution of test nodes, this
failure mainly occurred at OVH nodes, in which there is no dedicated
swap device. As a result, at OVH nodes, local disk is used for swap
when memory is over-consuming. It looks this leads to resource
starvation, which cause the failure.

This patch attempted to reduce the memory consumption of the gate
tests. In the api test, the number of worker nodes was reduced from
2 to 1. In all tests (api/k8s/swarm/mesos), the memory of worker node
was reduced from 1G to 512M.

Closes-Bug: #1542386
Change-Id: If7822d07f95ebc935a8763b92f038f10cf07b5ca

commit_message:
Use keystoneclient functions to receive endpoint

Use keystoneclient function get_urls from service catalog to
search glance endpoints. So the search logic will be defined
in keystone and glance only works with received endpoints.

Closes-Bug: #1544469

commit_message:
Support to event filtering by level names

We don't have the event filtering implemented properly so far. It
doesn't make sense for users to specify event level values when listing
events. This patch adds a translation utility to do the conversion.

Change-Id: I51bfe6e7d1bf7e7afea7e93720bc78201c78fed8

that py34 related tests may fail.The following patch fixes it.
Ref: https://review.openstack.org/#/q/status:merged++topic:bug/1489059,n,z

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I8a47387790ddbd338c41856ba46ff6eb177d7ff2
Closes-bug: #1489059

commit_message:
UI: table pagination logic encapsulation

* following https://review.openstack.org/#/c/266826/ suggestion: API requests
  that required UI pagination will be passed via generic handler.
* At first I've written a decorator - which I didn't like,
  feel faulty by design - too many returns and over complicated blocks...

Partially implements blueprint: mistral-dashboard-executions-screen

Change-Id: Ie131bf74a74b816d2779888c6c23e7bcfa4b8f22

commit_message:
Allow setting default value for config_drive

This adds a setting that can be used to specify the default value
for the Configuration Drive option when launching an instance.

Closes-Bug: #1537106
Change-Id: If402d3331158b462bece27fa6fce2bdb7f6a4a2e

commit_message:
Try to be more verbose on sec group error

Try to identify if the error is due to the security rule
already existing and return the proper message in that case to
not confuse the user.

Change-Id: I13346611b9d7309f84a5bfba8b69ea5e65d0a02a
Closes-Bug: 1298460

commit_message:
Preallocate swapfile

If we need to use a swapfile preallocate it so that we don't get wedged
when both memory and disk have no more space available.

Change-Id: I6517851497a1310f633b5ad9ab5d19e5b2ecce36

subject: Stop using build-dep for numpy/pyyaml depends
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-11 14:33:37.000000000', 'files': ['tools/integration.sh'], 'message': 'Stop using build-dep for numpy/pyyaml depends

The build-dep command requires source repos, which we do not mirror as
nothing else other than this uses them in our gate. However, we can
just list the things these packages need directly instead of relying on
the debian packaging to tell us what we need to build them.

Change-Id: Ib438fec0c706fe2f3af507ef2d75c3456ed726a2
'}]
commit_message:
Stop using build-dep for numpy/pyyaml depends

The build-dep command requires source repos, which we do not mirror as
nothing else other than this uses them in our gate. However, we can
just list the things these packages need directly instead of relying on
the debian packaging to tell us what we need to build them.

Change-Id: Ib438fec0c706fe2f3af507ef2d75c3456ed726a2

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-06 05:52:12.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py'], 'message': 'Fix image volume creation error

When "image_upload_use_cinder_backend = True" is specified to
the volume backend and the Glance cinder store is enabled,
upload-to-image command fails with the following error:

  Create clone_image_volume: xxx for image xxx failed
  (Exception: An object of type VolumeAttachmentList is required
   in field volume_attachment, not a )

This is due to unnecessary attributes specified in the volume
params, such as 'volume_attachment' or 'consistencygroup'.
This patch removes the unnecessary attributes from the params.

Change-Id: Ia416cb6686312e1591de7fe40a7ce7d6aa2fce7d
Closes-Bug: #1529762
Related-Bug: #1528087
'}]
commit_message:
Fix image volume creation error

When "image_upload_use_cinder_backend = True" is specified to
the volume backend and the Glance cinder store is enabled,
upload-to-image command fails with the following error:

  Create clone_image_volume: xxx for image xxx failed
  (Exception: An object of type VolumeAttachmentList is required
   in field volume_attachment, not a )

This is due to unnecessary attributes specified in the volume
params, such as 'volume_attachment' or 'consistencygroup'.
This patch removes the unnecessary attributes from the params.

Change-Id: Ia416cb6686312e1591de7fe40a7ce7d6aa2fce7d
Closes-Bug: #1529762
Related-Bug: #1528087

revisions:

The restrictions on PowerVM partition names are more stringent than

commit_message:
Sanitize PowerVM partition name

The restrictions on PowerVM partition names are more stringent than
those on nova instance names.  To avoid annoying API errors, if a name
is accepted by nova, we scrub it (using a provided pypowervm interface)
such that it becomes acceptable for PowerVM.

Related-Bug: #1535338

Change-Id: Ic494f4ec05d9f6b1b2c93843ad404c6bee0bfba8

commit_message:
Added CORS support to Aodh

This adds the CORS support middleware to Aodh, allowing a deployer
to optionally configure rules under which a javascript client may
break the single-origin policy and access the API directly.

In previous patches, proper paste support for gabbi was added. This patch
modifies the paste.ini file for both aodh and gabbi, adds the CORS
configuration fixture to support unit tests, and adds CORS into configgen.

OpenStack CrossProject Spec:
   http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/cors-support.html
Oslo_Middleware Docs:
   http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.middleware/cors.html
OpenStack Cloud Admin Guide:
   http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/cross_project_cors.html
DocImpact: Add link to CORS configuration in admin cloud guide.

There are several reasons for this change:
- removes the need for the custome py3 test dependencies
- makes the broken tests more visible because they are listed
  instead of the working ones

  py3

bp python3

Change-Id: I7472eec05d80cdd99c0ee376159578e0d7306f51
'}]
commit_message:
Stop using nose as a Python3 test runner

There are several reasons for this change:
- removes the need for the custome py3 test dependencies
- makes the broken tests more visible because they are listed
  instead of the working ones
- using a blacklist means that new test files are tested by default in
  py3

bp python3

Change-Id: I7472eec05d80cdd99c0ee376159578e0d7306f51

subject: Restore tox.ini hack to pre-depend on pip>=6
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-10 04:06:47.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Restore tox.ini hack to pre-depend on pip>=6

The ";python_version='2.7'" construct in requirements.txt requires
pip>=6 before it can be parsed correctly.  tox/virtualenv will usually
create the venv with the *system* pip version, which may be too old (eg:
python-pip is 1.5.6-7 in Debian testing at time of writing).

It seems tox/pip/setup.py all lack a clean way to specify dependencies
that will be installed before setup.py is actually invoked, so this
change hacks this in using the tox.ini install_command.

(This reverts this portion of Icf33533348b8b6088abe3d4de5a84f253fe3836d,
which inadvertently(?) removed this line amongst other tox.ini cleanups)

Change-Id: Id291da0b0d660cbfed5f8f683562eebdeb9aaabf
'}]
commit_message:
Restore tox.ini hack to pre-depend on pip>=6

The ";python_version='2.7'" construct in requirements.txt requires
pip>=6 before it can be parsed correctly.  tox/virtualenv will usually
create the venv with the *system* pip version, which may be too old (eg:
python-pip is 1.5.6-7 in Debian testing at time of writing).

It seems tox/pip/setup.py all lack a clean way to specify dependencies
that will be installed before setup.py is actually invoked, so this
change hacks this in using the tox.ini install_command.

(This reverts this portion of Icf33533348b8b6088abe3d4de5a84f253fe3836d,
which inadvertently(?) removed this line amongst other tox.ini cleanups)

Change-Id: Id291da0b0d660cbfed5f8f683562eebdeb9aaabf

commit_message:
Limit apt cache invalidation

This fix will update APT caches if they are 24h old and
prevents situation where the APT cache will invalidate during
playbook runs, causing unnecessary delays during execution.
The override apt_cache_expiration_time has been set to 24 hours
and can be altered if necessary.

Change-Id: I4c2ebe4c3a5e6df91acfe23daf837b31d7005213
Closes-Bug: #1544322

commit_message:
grab less data when adding measures

get aggregatedtimeserie starting from first timestamp in timeseries
to be added. this should minimise the amount of split timeseries
we need to update, specifically for policies with a lot of points.

Change-Id: Ic8768623bcce1f6340ce2928367199b70b83d6c5

revisions:

commit_message:
Improve is-public argument in env-template-create

Changed --is-public argument to action='store_true' to avoid user
input additional true/false. This is more straight to user, and
consistent with --is-public argument in other subcommand, like
'package-import'.

Change-Id: I6bc90a81156b800a88a2801556769977b4b8df79
Closes-Bug: #1544449

commit_message:
Support MTU advertisement using IPv6 RAs

RFC4861 allows us to specify the Link MTU using IPv6 RAs.
When advertise_mtu is set in the config, this patch supports
advertising the LinkMTU using Router Advertisements.

Partially Implements: blueprint mtu-selection-and-advertisement
Closes-Bug: #1495444
Change-Id: I50d40cd3b8eabf1899461a80e729d5bd1e727f28
